title: Matthew 1:1
content: 1 The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, son of David, son of Abraham:

title: Matthew 1:2
content: 2 Abraham fathered Isaac, and Isaac fathered Jacob, and Jacob fathered Judah and his brothers,

title: Matthew 1:3
content: 3 and Judah fathered Perez and Zerah by Tamar, and Perez fathered Hezrom, and Hezrom fathered Aram,

title: Matthew 1:4
content: 4 and Aram fathered Amminadab, and Amminadab fathered Nahshon, and Nahshon fathered Salmon,

title: Matthew 1:5
content: 5 and Salmon fathered Boaz by Rahab, and Boaz fathered Obed by Ruth, and Obed fathered Jesse,

title: Matthew 1:6
content: 6 and Jesse fathered David the king, and David fathered Solomon by the {wife} of Uriah,

title: Matthew 1:7
content: 7 and Solomon fathered Rehoboam, and Rehoboam fathered Abijah, and Abijah fathered Asaph,

title: Matthew 1:8
content: 8 and Asaph fathered Jehoshaphat, and Jehoshaphat fathered Joram, and Joram fathered Ozias,

title: Matthew 1:9
content: 9 and Ozias fathered Jotham, and Jotham fathered Ahaz, and Ahaz fathered Hezekiah,

title: Matthew 1:10
content: 10 and Hezekiah fathered Manasseh, and Manasseh fathered Amos, and Amos fathered Josiah,

title: Matthew 1:11
content: 11 and Josiah fathered Jechoniah and his brothers at the Babylonian deportation,

title: Matthew 1:12
content: 12 and after the Babylonian deportation, Jechoniah fathered Salathiel, and Salathiel fathered Zerubbabel,

title: Matthew 1:13
content: 13 and Zerubbabel fathered Abiud, and Abiud fathered Eliakim, and Eliakim fathered Azor,

title: Matthew 1:14
content: 14 and Azor fathered Zadok, and Zadok fathered Achim, and Achim fathered Eliud,

title: Matthew 1:15
content: 15 and Eliud fathered Eleazar, and Eleazar fathered Matthan, and Matthan fathered Jacob,

title: Matthew 1:16
content: 16 and Jacob fathered Joseph the husband of Mary, by whom Jesus was born, the one called Christ.

title: Matthew 1:17
content: 17 Therefore, all the generations from Abraham until David {were} 14 generations, and from David until the Babylonian deportation {were} 14 generations, and from the Babylonian deportation until the Christ {were} 14 generations.

title: Matthew 1:18
content: 18 Now the birth of Jesus Christ was thus: His mother, Mary, having been engaged to marry Joseph, before they came together, was found having in the womb from the Holy Spirit.

title: Matthew 1:19
content: 19 Now Joseph her husband, being righteous, and not wanting to publicly disgrace her, intended to divorce her secretly.

title: Matthew 1:20
content: 20 But he having reflected on these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him by way of a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, you should not fear to take Mary as your wife, because the one having been conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.

title: Matthew 1:21
content: 21 And she will bear a son, and you will call his name Jesus, for he will save his people from their sins.”

title: Matthew 1:22
content: 22 Now all this happened so that might be fulfilled {what} was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,

title: Matthew 1:23
content: 23 “Behold, the virgin will have in her womb and bear a son, and they will call his name Immanuel”—which is translated, “God with us.”

title: Matthew 1:24
content: 24 And Joseph, having been awakened from sleep, did as the angel of the Lord commanded him and took her {as} his wife.

title: Matthew 1:25
content: 25 And he did not know her until she bore a son. And he called his name Jesus.

title: Matthew 2:1
content: 1 Now, Jesus having been born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, learned men from the east arrived in Jerusalem,

title: Matthew 2:2
content: 2 saying, “Where is the one having been born King of the Jews? For we saw his star in the east and came to worship him.”

title: Matthew 2:3
content: 3 But having heard this, Herod the king became troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

title: Matthew 2:4
content: 4 And having brought together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he inquired from them, “Where is the Christ being born?”

title: Matthew 2:5
content: 5 And they said to him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for thus it has been written through the prophet,

title: Matthew 2:6
content: 6 ‘And you, Bethlehem, land of Judah, are by no means least among the leaders of Judah, for from you will come out a ruling one who will shepherd my people Israel.’”

title: Matthew 2:7
content: 7 Then Herod, having secretly called the learned men, inquired from them the time of the appearing of the star.

title: Matthew 2:8
content: 8 And having sent them to Bethlehem, he said, “Having gone, search carefully for the young child, and after you have found him, report to me so that I also, having come, might worship him.”

title: Matthew 2:9
content: 9 And they, having heard the king, went, and behold, the star that they saw in the east was going before them until, having come, it stood over where the young child was.

title: Matthew 2:10
content: 10 And having seen the star, they rejoiced with very great joy.

title: Matthew 2:11
content: 11 And having gone into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother. And having fallen down, they worshiped him, and having opened their treasures, they offered him gifts: gold and frankincense and myrrh.

title: Matthew 2:12
content: 12 And having been warned through a dream not to return to Herod, they departed to their country by another way.

title: Matthew 2:13
content: 13 Now they having departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appears to Joseph by means of a dream, saying, “Having gotten up, take the young child and his mother, and flee to Egypt, and remain there until I tell you, for Herod is going to seek the young child to kill him.”

title: Matthew 2:14
content: 14 And having gotten up, he took the young child and his mother at night and departed for Egypt,

title: Matthew 2:15
content: 15 and he was there until the death of Herod, in order that might be fulfilled {what} was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, “Out of Egypt I called my son.”

title: Matthew 2:16
content: 16 Then Herod, having seen that he had been mocked by the learned men, was very angry, and having sent forth, he killed all the male children in Bethlehem and in all its region, from two years and under, according to the time that he had determined exactly from the learned men.

title: Matthew 2:17
content: 17 Then it was fulfilled {what} was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, saying,

title: Matthew 2:18
content: 18 “A voice was heard in Ramah, weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children, and not willing to be comforted, because they are no more.”

title: Matthew 2:19
content: 19 Now Herod having died, behold, an angel of the Lord appears by means of a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

title: Matthew 2:20
content: 20 saying, “Having gotten up, take the young child and his mother and go to the land of Israel, for the ones seeking the life of the child have died.”

title: Matthew 2:21
content: 21 And he, having gotten up, took the young child and his mother, and entered into the land of Israel.

title: Matthew 2:22
content: 22 But having heard that Archelaus is reigning over Judea in the place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. But having been warned by means of a dream, he withdrew to the region of Galilee,

title: Matthew 2:23
content: 23 and having gone, he lived in a city being called Nazareth, so that it might be fulfilled {what} was spoken through the prophets, that he will be called a Nazarene.

title: Matthew 3:1
content: 1 Now in those days, John the Baptist comes, preaching in the wilderness of Judea,

title: Matthew 3:2
content: 2 saying, “Repent, for the kingdom of the heavens is near.”

title: Matthew 3:3
content: 3 For this is the one spoken of through Isaiah the prophet, saying, “A voice of one calling out in the wilderness, ‘Make ready the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.’”

title: Matthew 3:4
content: 4 Now this John had his clothing from the hair of a camel and a leather belt around his waist, and his food was locusts and wild honey.

title: Matthew 3:5
content: 5 Then were going out to him Jerusalem, and all Judea, and all the {region} around the Jordan,

title: Matthew 3:6
content: 6 and being baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.

title: Matthew 3:7
content: 7 Now having seen many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism, he said to them, “Offspring of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?

title: Matthew 3:8
content: 8 Therefore, produce fruit worthy of repentance.

title: Matthew 3:9
content: 9 And you should not think to say in yourselves, ‘We have Abraham {as} father.’ For I say to you that God is able to raise up children for Abraham from these stones.

title: Matthew 3:10
content: 10 But already the ax is set against the root of the trees. So, every tree not producing good fruit is chopped down and thrown into a fire.

title: Matthew 3:11
content: 11 I indeed baptize you with water for repentance. But the one coming after me is more powerful than I, of whom I am not worthy to carry away his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire,

title: Matthew 3:12
content: 12 whose winnowing fork {is} in his hand, and he will thoroughly clear off his threshing floor and gather his wheat into the storehouse. But he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”

title: Matthew 3:13
content: 13 Then Jesus comes from Galilee to the Jordan, to John, to be baptized by him.

title: Matthew 3:14
content: 14 But John was hindering him, saying, “I have need to be baptized by you, and yet you come to me?”

title: Matthew 3:15
content: 15 But answering, Jesus said to him, “Permit {it} now, for in this way it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then he permits him.

title: Matthew 3:16
content: 16 Now having been baptized, Jesus immediately came up from the water, and behold, the heavens were opened to him, and he saw the Spirit of God coming down like a dove, resting upon him,

title: Matthew 3:17
content: 17 and behold, a voice from the heavens, saying, “This is my beloved Son with whom I am well pleased.”

title: Matthew 4:1
content: 1 Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.

title: Matthew 4:2
content: 2 And having fasted 40 days and 40 nights, afterward he was hungry.

title: Matthew 4:3
content: 3 And having approached, the one tempting said to him, “If you are the Son of God, speak so that these stones might become loaves.”

title: Matthew 4:4
content: 4 But he, answering, said, “It is written, ‘Man will not live on bread alone, but by every word coming through the mouth of God.’”

title: Matthew 4:5
content: 5 Then the devil takes him into the holy city, and he set him on the highest point of the temple,

title: Matthew 4:6
content: 6 and says to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it is written, ‘He will command his angels concerning you,’ and, ‘They will lift you up in their hands, lest you strike your foot against a stone.’”

title: Matthew 4:7
content: 7 Jesus said to him, “Again it is written, ‘You will not test the Lord your God.’”

title: Matthew 4:8
content: 8 Again, the devil takes him to a very high mountain and shows him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.

title: Matthew 4:9
content: 9 And he said to him, “All these things I will give you, if having fallen down, you would worship me.”

title: Matthew 4:10
content: 10 Then Jesus says to him, “Go away, Satan! For it is written, ‘You will worship the Lord your God, and you will serve only him.’”

title: Matthew 4:11
content: 11 Then the devil leaves him, and behold, angels came and began to minister to him.

title: Matthew 4:12
content: 12 Now having heard that John had been arrested, he withdrew into Galilee.

title: Matthew 4:13
content: 13 And having left Nazareth, having come, he lived in Capernaum by the sea, in the territories of Zebulun and Naphtali,

title: Matthew 4:14
content: 14 so that it might be fulfilled what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,

title: Matthew 4:15
content: 15 “The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, { the} way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles—

title: Matthew 4:16
content: 16 the people sitting in darkness have seen a great light, and to the ones sitting in the region and shadow of death, upon them has a light arisen.”

title: Matthew 4:17
content: 17 From that time Jesus began to preach and to say, “Repent, for the kingdom of the heavens has come near.”

title: Matthew 4:18
content: 18 Now walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.

title: Matthew 4:19
content: 19 And he says to them, “Come after me, and I will make you fishers of men.”

title: Matthew 4:20
content: 20 And immediately, they, having left the nets, followed him.

title: Matthew 4:21
content: 21 And having gone on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the {son} of Zebedee, and John his brother in the boat with Zebedee their father mending their nets, and he called them,

title: Matthew 4:22
content: 22 and immediately they, having left the boat and their father, followed him.

title: Matthew 4:23
content: 23 And he was going around in all of Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.

title: Matthew 4:24
content: 24 And the news of him went out into all Syria, and they brought to him all the ones having sickness, being afflicted by various diseases and pains, and being possessed by demons, and the epileptic and the paralytic, and he healed them.

title: Matthew 4:25
content: 25 And large crowds followed him from Galilee and Decapolis and Jerusalem and Judea and beyond the Jordan.

title: Matthew 5:1
content: 1 Now having seen the crowds, he went up on the mountain, and he having sat down, his disciples came to him.

title: Matthew 5:2
content: 2 And having opened his mouth, he taught them, saying,

title: Matthew 5:3
content: 3 “Blessed {are} the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of the heavens.

title: Matthew 5:4
content: 4 Blessed {are} the ones mourning, for they will be comforted.

title: Matthew 5:5
content: 5 Blessed {are} the meek, for they will inherit the earth.

title: Matthew 5:6
content: 6 Blessed {are} the ones hungering and thirsting for righteousness, for they will be fed.

title: Matthew 5:7
content: 7 Blessed {are} the merciful, for they will obtain mercy.

title: Matthew 5:8
content: 8 Blessed {are} the pure in heart, for they will see God.

title: Matthew 5:9
content: 9 Blessed {are} the peacemakers, for they will be called sons of God.

title: Matthew 5:10
content: 10 Blessed {are} the ones persecuted for the sake of righteousness, for theirs is the kingdom of the heavens.

title: Matthew 5:11
content: 11 Blessed are you when they insult you and persecute {you} and say every evil thing against you, lying, because of me.

title: Matthew 5:12
content: 12 Rejoice and be very glad, for your reward {is} great in the heavens, for in this way they persecuted the prophets before you.

title: Matthew 5:13
content: 13 You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt is made tasteless, with what might it be made salty again? It is good for nothing any longer, except having been thrown out, to be trampled by men.

title: Matthew 5:14
content: 14 You are the light of the world. A city being set on top of a mountain is not able to be hidden.

title: Matthew 5:15
content: 15 Neither do they light a lamp and put it under a basket, but rather on the lampstand, and it shines for all the ones in the house.

title: Matthew 5:16
content: 16 Let your light shine before men in such a way so that they might see your good deeds and might glorify your Father in the heavens.

title: Matthew 5:17
content: 17 Do not think that I came to destroy the law or the prophets. I came not to destroy but to fulfill.

title: Matthew 5:18
content: 18 For truly I say to you, until the heaven and the earth passes away, one jot or one tittle will certainly not pass away from the law until all things are accomplished.

title: Matthew 5:19
content: 19 Therefore, whoever annuls one of the least of these commandments and teaches men to do so will be called least in the kingdom of the heavens. But whoever does and teaches {them}, that one will be called great in the kingdom of the heavens.

title: Matthew 5:20
content: 20 For I say to you that unless your righteousness abounds more than that of the scribes and Pharisees, you will certainly not enter into the kingdom of the heavens.

title: Matthew 5:21
content: 21 You have heard that it was said to the ancient ones, ‘Do not kill,’ and, ‘Whoever kills will be subject to the judgment.’

title: Matthew 5:22
content: 22 But I say to you that everyone being angry with his brother will be subject to the judgment. And whoever says to his brother, ‘Raka!’ will be subject to the council. And whoever says, ‘You fool!’ will be subject to the Gehenna of fire.

title: Matthew 5:23
content: 23 Therefore, if you offer your gift at the altar and there you remember that your brother has something against you,

title: Matthew 5:24
content: 24 leave your gift there in front of the altar and go; first be reconciled with your brother, and then, having come, offer your gift.

title: Matthew 5:25
content: 25 Be in agreement with your accuser quickly while you are with him on the way, lest your accuser might hand you over to the judge, and the judge to the officer, and you will be thrown into prison.

title: Matthew 5:26
content: 26 Truly I say to you, you will certainly not come out from there until you have paid the last quadrans.

title: Matthew 5:27
content: 27 You have heard that it was said, ‘Do not commit adultery.’

title: Matthew 5:28
content: 28 But I say to you that everyone looking at a woman to lust after her has already committed adultery with her in his heart.

title: Matthew 5:29
content: 29 But if your right eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out and throw {it} away from you. For it is better for you that one of your members would perish and your whole body would not be thrown into Gehenna.

title: Matthew 5:30
content: 30 And if your right hand causes you to stumble, cut it off and throw {it} away from you. For it is better for you that one of your members would perish and your whole body would not go into Gehenna.

title: Matthew 5:31
content: 31 Now it has been said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife, let him give her a certificate of divorce.’

title: Matthew 5:32
content: 32 But I say to you that everyone divorcing his wife, except for a report of sexual immorality, causes her to commit adultery. And whoever marries {the one who} has been divorced commits adultery.

title: Matthew 5:33
content: 33 Again, you have heard that it was said to the ancient ones, ‘Do not break an oath, but carry out your oaths to the Lord.’

title: Matthew 5:34
content: 34 But I tell you not to swear at all, neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God;

title: Matthew 5:35
content: 35 nor by the earth, for it is a footstool for his feet; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.

title: Matthew 5:36
content: 36 Neither should you swear by your head, for you are not able to make one hair white or black.

title: Matthew 5:37
content: 37 But let your word be ‘Yes, yes,’ {or} ‘No, no.’ But anything greater than this is from the evil one.

title: Matthew 5:38
content: 38 You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye in exchange for an eye, and a tooth in exchange for a tooth.’

title: Matthew 5:39
content: 39 But I tell you not to resist the evil one. Instead, whoever strikes you on the right cheek, turn to him the other also.

title: Matthew 5:40
content: 40 And to the one wanting to have judgment passed upon you and to take away your tunic, let him also have your cloak.

title: Matthew 5:41
content: 41 And whoever will press you into service for one mile, go with him two.

title: Matthew 5:42
content: 42 Give to the one asking you, and do not turn away from the one wanting to borrow from you.

title: Matthew 5:43
content: 43 You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’

title: Matthew 5:44
content: 44 But I say to you, love your enemies and pray on behalf of the ones persecuting you

title: Matthew 5:45
content: 45 so that you might be sons of your Father in the heavens. For he makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and he sends rain on the just and the unjust.

title: Matthew 5:46
content: 46 For if you love the ones loving you, what reward do you have? Do not even the tax collectors do the same thing?

title: Matthew 5:47
content: 47 And if you greet only your brothers, what do you do more? Do not even the Gentiles do the same thing?

title: Matthew 5:48
content: 48 Therefore, you shall be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.

title: Matthew 6:1
content: 1 Now take heed not to do your righteousness before men to be seen by them, otherwise, you do not have a reward with your Father in the heavens.

title: Matthew 6:2
content: 2 So when you give alms, do not sound a trumpet before yourself even as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets so that they may be glorified by men. Truly I say to you, they have their reward in full.

title: Matthew 6:3
content: 3 But you, giving alms, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing

title: Matthew 6:4
content: 4 so that your alms may be in secret, and your Father seeing in secret will reward you.

title: Matthew 6:5
content: 5 And when you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, for they love to pray, having stood in the synagogues and on the corners of the street, so that they may be seen by men. Truly I say to you, they have their reward in full.

title: Matthew 6:6
content: 6 But you, when you pray, enter into your inner chamber, and having shut your door, pray to your Father in secret, and your Father seeing in secret will reward you.

title: Matthew 6:7
content: 7 Now praying, do not make useless repetitions even as the Gentiles, for they think that because of their many words they will be heard.

title: Matthew 6:8
content: 8 Therefore, you should not be like them, for your Father knows what need you have before you ask him.

title: Matthew 6:9
content: 9 Therefore, you must pray like this: ‘Our Father in the heavens, let your name be made holy.

title: Matthew 6:10
content: 10 Let your kingdom come, let your will be done as in heaven also on earth.

title: Matthew 6:11
content: 11 Give us today our daily bread;

title: Matthew 6:12
content: 12 and forgive us our debts, as we also forgave our debtors;

title: Matthew 6:13
content: 13 and do not bring us into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one.’

title: Matthew 6:14
content: 14 For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

title: Matthew 6:15
content: 15 But if you do not forgive the men, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

title: Matthew 6:16
content: 16 Now when you fast, do not be mournful as the hypocrites, for they disfigure their faces so that they may be seen as fasting by men. Truly I say to you, they have their reward in full.

title: Matthew 6:17
content: 17 But you, {when} fasting, anoint your head and wash your face

title: Matthew 6:18
content: 18 so that you would not be seen as fasting by men, but only by your Father in secret; and your Father, seeing in secret, will reward you.

title: Matthew 6:19
content: 19 Do not store up for yourselves treasures on the earth, where moth and rust destroy, and where thieves break in and steal.

title: Matthew 6:20
content: 20 Instead, store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroys, and where thieves do not break in nor steal.

title: Matthew 6:21
content: 21 For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

title: Matthew 6:22
content: 22 The lamp of the body is the eye. Therefore, if your eye is healthy, your whole body will be illuminated.

title: Matthew 6:23
content: 23 But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be dark. Therefore, if the light in you is darkness, how great {is} the darkness!

title: Matthew 6:24
content: 24 No one is able to serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and will love the other, or else he will be devoted to one and will despise the other. You are not able to serve God and wealth.

title: Matthew 6:25
content: 25 Because of this I say to you, do not worry about your life, what you might eat or what you might drink, nor about your body, what you might wear. Is not life more than food, and the body, {than} clothing?

title: Matthew 6:26
content: 26 Look at the birds of the sky, that they do not sow nor reap nor gather into barns, but your heavenly Father feeds them. {Are} you not more valuable than they?

title: Matthew 6:27
content: 27 But which of you, being anxious, is able to add one cubit to his lifespan?

title: Matthew 6:28
content: 28 And why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field—how they grow. They do not labor, neither do they spin.

title: Matthew 6:29
content: 29 But I say to you that not even Solomon in all his glory clothed himself like one of these.

title: Matthew 6:30
content: 30 But if God thus clothes the grass of the field, existing today and tomorrow being thrown into an oven, {will he} not much more you, ones of little faith?

title: Matthew 6:31
content: 31 Therefore, you should not be anxious, saying, ‘What might we eat?’ or, ‘What might we drink?’ or, ‘What might we wear?’

title: Matthew 6:32
content: 32 For the Gentiles seek all these things; for your heavenly Father knows that you need all of these things.

title: Matthew 6:33
content: 33 But seek first the kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.

title: Matthew 6:34
content: 34 Therefore, you should not be anxious for tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Sufficient for the day {is} its evil.

title: Matthew 7:1
content: 1 Do not judge, so that you will not be judged.

title: Matthew 7:2
content: 2 For with the judgment by which you judge, you will be judged, and with the measure by which you measure, it will be measured to you.

title: Matthew 7:3
content: 3 Now why do you look at the speck of wood that {is} in the eye of your brother, but you do not notice the log in your eye?

title: Matthew 7:4
content: 4 Or how will you say to your brother, ‘Let me take out the speck of wood from your eye,’ while behold, the log {is} in your eye?

title: Matthew 7:5
content: 5 You hypocrite! First take out the log from your eye, and then you will see clearly to take out the speck of wood from the eye of your brother.

title: Matthew 7:6
content: 6 You should neither give the holy to the dogs nor should you throw your pearls in front of the pigs. Otherwise, they will trample them under their feet, and having turned, they will tear you to pieces.

title: Matthew 7:7
content: 7 Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.

title: Matthew 7:8
content: 8 For everyone asking receives; and the one seeking finds; and to the one knocking, it will be opened.

title: Matthew 7:9
content: 9 Or what man is there from among you, of whom his son will ask for bread—he will not give him a stone, will he?

title: Matthew 7:10
content: 10 Or he will also ask for a fish—he will not give him a snake, will he?

title: Matthew 7:11
content: 11 Therefore, if you, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in the heavens give good things to the ones asking him?

title: Matthew 7:12
content: 12 Therefore, all things in as much as you desire that men do to you, in this manner also, you do to them, for this is the Law and the Prophets.

title: Matthew 7:13
content: 13 Enter through the narrow gate. For wide {is} the gate and broad {is} the road that is leading to destruction, and there are many entering through it.

title: Matthew 7:14
content: 14 For the gate {is} narrow and the road has been made narrow that is leading to life, and there are few finding it.

title: Matthew 7:15
content: 15 Beware of the false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravenous wolves.

title: Matthew 7:16
content: 16 By their fruits you will recognize them. They do not gather grapes from a thornbush or figs from thistles, do they?

title: Matthew 7:17
content: 17 In the same way, every good tree produces good fruits, but the rotten tree produces bad fruits.

title: Matthew 7:18
content: 18 A good tree is not able to produce bad fruits, nor a rotten tree to produce good fruits.

title: Matthew 7:19
content: 19 Every tree not producing good fruit is cut down and thrown into a fire.

title: Matthew 7:20
content: 20 So then, by their fruits you will recognize them.

title: Matthew 7:21
content: 21 Not everyone saying to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter into the kingdom of the heavens, but the one doing the will of my Father in the heavens.

title: Matthew 7:22
content: 22 Many will say to me in that day, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name, and in your name cast out demons, and in your name do many mighty deeds?’

title: Matthew 7:23
content: 23 And then I will publicly declare to them, ‘I never knew you! Go away from me, the ones practicing lawlessness!’

title: Matthew 7:24
content: 24 Therefore, everyone who hears these words of mine and does them will be compared to a wise man who built his house upon the rock.

title: Matthew 7:25
content: 25 And the rain came down, and the floods came, and the winds blew and struck against that house, but it did not fall down, for it had been founded on the rock.

title: Matthew 7:26
content: 26 But everyone hearing these words of mine and not doing them will be compared to a foolish man who built his house upon the sand.

title: Matthew 7:27
content: 27 And the rain came down, and the floods came, and the winds blew and struck against that house, and it fell, and its destruction was great.”

title: Matthew 7:28
content: 28 And it happened that when Jesus finished speaking these words, the crowds were astonished at his teaching,

title: Matthew 7:29
content: 29 for he was teaching them as having authority, and not as their scribes.

title: Matthew 8:1
content: 1 Now {when} he had come down from the mountain, large crowds followed him.

title: Matthew 8:2
content: 2 And behold, a leper, having approached, bowed before him, saying, “Lord, if you are willing, you are able to make me clean.”

title: Matthew 8:3
content: 3 And having reached out his hand, he touched him, saying, “I am willing. Be clean.” And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

title: Matthew 8:4
content: 4 And Jesus says to him, “See that you tell no one, but go, show yourself to the priest and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”

title: Matthew 8:5
content: 5 Now {when} he had entered into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, begging him

title: Matthew 8:6
content: 6 and saying, “Lord, my servant has been lying in the house paralyzed, being tormented terribly.”

title: Matthew 8:7
content: 7 And he says to him, “I, {when} I have come, will heal him.”

title: Matthew 8:8
content: 8 And answering, the centurion said, “Lord, I am not worthy that you might enter under my roof, but only speak a word, and my servant will be healed.

title: Matthew 8:9
content: 9 For I also am a man placed under authority, having soldiers under me, and I say to this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and to another one, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does {it}.”

title: Matthew 8:10
content: 10 But having heard this, Jesus was amazed and said to the ones following him, “Truly I say to you, I have found such great faith from no one in Israel.

title: Matthew 8:11
content: 11 But I tell you that many will come from east and west, and they will recline to eat with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of the heavens.

title: Matthew 8:12
content: 12 But the sons of the kingdom will be thrown out into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and grinding of the teeth.”

title: Matthew 8:13
content: 13 And Jesus said to the centurion, “Go! As you believed, let it be done for you.” And the servant was healed at that hour.

title: Matthew 8:14
content: 14 And {when} Jesus had come into the house of Peter, he saw his mother-in-law having been laid down and being sick with a fever.

title: Matthew 8:15
content: 15 And he touched her hand, and the fever left her, and she got up and began to serve him.

title: Matthew 8:16
content: 16 Now evening having come, they brought to him many being possessed by demons, and he cast out the spirits with a word and healed all the ones having sickness,

title: Matthew 8:17
content: 17 so that might be fulfilled that which had been spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying, “He himself took our sicknesses and bore our diseases.”

title: Matthew 8:18
content: 18 Now Jesus, having seen a crowd around him, commanded to depart to the other side.

title: Matthew 8:19
content: 19 And having approached, a scribe said to him, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”

title: Matthew 8:20
content: 20 And Jesus says to him, “The foxes have dens, and the birds of the sky, nests, but the Son of Man does not have {a place} where he might lay his head.”

title: Matthew 8:21
content: 21 Now another of the disciples said to him, “Lord, permit me first to go away and to bury my father.”

title: Matthew 8:22
content: 22 But Jesus says to him, “Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”

title: Matthew 8:23
content: 23 And {when} he had gotten into a boat, his disciples followed him.

title: Matthew 8:24
content: 24 And behold, a great storm happened on the sea, so that the boat was covered by the waves. But he was sleeping.

title: Matthew 8:25
content: 25 And having approached, they woke him, saying, “Lord, save us; we are perishing!”

title: Matthew 8:26
content: 26 And he says to them, “Why are you cowardly, you of little faith?” Then, having gotten up, he rebuked the winds and the sea, and a great calm happened.

title: Matthew 8:27
content: 27 But the men marveled, saying, “What sort of {man} is he, that even the winds and the sea obey him?”

title: Matthew 8:28
content: 28 And {when} he had come to the other side, to the region of the Gadarenes, two men met him, being possessed by demons, coming out of the tombs, very violent, so that no one was strong enough to pass through that road.

title: Matthew 8:29
content: 29 And behold, they cried out, saying, “What to us and to you, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the set time?”

title: Matthew 8:30
content: 30 Now a herd of many pigs was feeding at a distance from them.

title: Matthew 8:31
content: 31 But the demons were begging him, saying, “If you cast us out, send us away into the herd of the pigs.”

title: Matthew 8:32
content: 32 And he said to them, “Go!” And they, having come out, went away into the pigs; and behold, the whole herd rushed down the steep slope into the sea, and they died in the water.

title: Matthew 8:33
content: 33 Now the ones feeding them ran away and, having gone away to the city, they reported everything, and the {things concerning} the ones possessed by demons.

title: Matthew 8:34
content: 34 And behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus. And having seen him, they begged him that he would depart from their region.

title: Matthew 9:1
content: 1 And having gotten into a boat, he crossed over and came to his own city.

title: Matthew 9:2
content: 2 And behold, they were bringing to him a paralytic lying on a mat. And Jesus, having seen their faith, said to the paralytic, “Child, have courage. Your sins are forgiven.”

title: Matthew 9:3
content: 3 And behold, some of the scribes said among themselves, “This one blasphemes.”

title: Matthew 9:4
content: 4 And Jesus, having seen their thoughts, said, “For what reason do you think evil in your hearts?

title: Matthew 9:5
content: 5 For which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins have been forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?

title: Matthew 9:6
content: 6 But in order that you might know that the Son of Man has authority on the earth to forgive sins,”—he then says to the paralytic—“Getting up, pick up your mat, and go to your house.”

title: Matthew 9:7
content: 7 And having gotten up, he went away to his house.

title: Matthew 9:8
content: 8 Now {when} the crowds had seen this, they were afraid and glorified God, having given such authority to men.

title: Matthew 9:9
content: 9 And Jesus, passing on from there, saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax collector’s office, and he says to him, “Follow me.” And having gotten up, he followed him.

title: Matthew 9:10
content: 10 And it happened that he was reclining to eat in the house, and behold, many tax collectors and sinners, having come, were dining with Jesus and his disciples.

title: Matthew 9:11
content: 11 And the Pharisees, having seen this, were saying to his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”

title: Matthew 9:12
content: 12 But he, having heard this, said, “The ones being healthy do not have need of a physician, but the ones having sickness.

title: Matthew 9:13
content: 13 But having gone, learn what this is: ‘I desire mercy and not sacrifice.’ For I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”

title: Matthew 9:14
content: 14 Then the disciples of John come to him, saying, “For what reason do we and the Pharisees often fast, but your disciples do not fast?”

title: Matthew 9:15
content: 15 And Jesus said to them, “The sons of the bridal chamber are not able to mourn while the bridegroom is still with them, are they? But days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.

title: Matthew 9:16
content: 16 Now no one puts a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, for its patch tears away from the garment, and a worse tear happens.

title: Matthew 9:17
content: 17 Neither do they put new wine into old wineskins. But if not, the skins are burst, and the wine is spilled, and the wineskins are destroyed. But they put new wine into new wineskins, and both are preserved.”

title: Matthew 9:18
content: 18 {While} he was saying these things to them, behold, a certain official, having approached, bowed down to him, saying, “My daughter has just now died, but, having come, lay your hand on her, and she will live.”

title: Matthew 9:19
content: 19 And having gotten up, Jesus and his disciples followed him.

title: Matthew 9:20
content: 20 And behold, a woman suffering from a discharge of blood for 12 years, having approached from behind, touched the edge of his cloak,

title: Matthew 9:21
content: 21 for she was saying in herself, “If only I touch his cloak, I will be saved.”

title: Matthew 9:22
content: 22 But Jesus, having turned and having seen her, said, “Daughter, take courage; your faith has saved you.” And the woman was saved from that hour.

title: Matthew 9:23
content: 23 And Jesus, having come to the house of the official and having seen the flute players and the crowd being disturbed,

title: Matthew 9:24
content: 24 said, “Go away, for the girl has not died, but sleeps.” And they were laughing at him.

title: Matthew 9:25
content: 25 But when the crowd had been put outside, having entered, he took her hand, and the girl was raised up.

title: Matthew 9:26
content: 26 And this report went out into all that region.

title: Matthew 9:27
content: 27 And {as} Jesus was departing from there, two blind men followed him, crying out and saying, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”

title: Matthew 9:28
content: 28 Now {when} he had come into the house, the blind men came to him and Jesus says to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?” They say to him, “Yes, Lord.”

title: Matthew 9:29
content: 29 Then he touched their eyes, saying, “Let it be done to you according to your faith.”

title: Matthew 9:30
content: 30 And their eyes were opened, and Jesus warned them, saying, “See that you let no one know {about this}.”

title: Matthew 9:31
content: 31 But they, having gone out, reported it in all that region.

title: Matthew 9:32
content: 32 Now {as} they were going away, behold, they brought to him a mute, demon-possessed man.

title: Matthew 9:33
content: 33 And the demon having been cast out, the mute {man} spoke, and the crowds marveled, saying, “Such as this has never been seen in Israel!”

title: Matthew 9:34
content: 34 But the Pharisees were saying, “By the ruler of the demons he casts out the demons.”

title: Matthew 9:35
content: 35 And Jesus was going around all the cities and the villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness.

title: Matthew 9:36
content: 36 Now having seen the crowds, he felt compassion for them, because they were troubled and discouraged, like sheep not having a shepherd.

title: Matthew 9:37
content: 37 Then he says to his disciples, “Indeed, the harvest {is} plentiful, but the laborers {are} few.

title: Matthew 9:38
content: 38 Therefore, earnestly ask the Lord of the harvest, so that he might send out laborers into his harvest.”

title: Matthew 10:1
content: 1 And having summoned his 12 disciples, he gave them authority over unclean spirits, so as to cast them out and to heal every disease and every sickness.

title: Matthew 10:2
content: 2 Now the names of the 12 apostles are these: first, Simon (called Peter), and Andrew his brother; and James the {son} of Zebedee, and John his brother;

title: Matthew 10:3
content: 3 Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James the {son} of Alphaeus and Thaddaeus;

title: Matthew 10:4
content: 4 Simon the Cananaios, and Judas Iscariot, the {one} having also handed him over.

title: Matthew 10:5
content: 5 These 12 Jesus sent out, having instructed them, saying, “Do not go on the way {to the} Gentiles, and do not enter into a city of the Samaritans.

title: Matthew 10:6
content: 6 But go instead to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

title: Matthew 10:7
content: 7 Now {as} you are going, preach, saying, ‘The kingdom of the heavens has come near.’

title: Matthew 10:8
content: 8 Heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse the lepers, {and} cast out demons. Freely you have received; freely give.

title: Matthew 10:9
content: 9 Do not acquire gold or silver or copper in your belts,

title: Matthew 10:10
content: 10 nor a bag for the road nor two tunics nor sandals nor a staff, for the laborer {is} worthy of his food.

title: Matthew 10:11
content: 11 But whatever city or village you enter into, find someone who is worthy in it and stay there until you go out.

title: Matthew 10:12
content: 12 Now entering into the house, greet it.

title: Matthew 10:13
content: 13 And if indeed the house is worthy, let your peace come upon it, but if it is not worthy, let your peace be returned to you.

title: Matthew 10:14
content: 14 And whoever does not receive you nor listen to your words, departing from that house or city, shake off the dust from your feet.

title: Matthew 10:15
content: 15 Truly I say to you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city.

title: Matthew 10:16
content: 16 Behold, I send you out as sheep in the midst of wolves, so become wise as the serpents and harmless as the doves.

title: Matthew 10:17
content: 17 But beware of the men, for they will hand you over to councils, and they will whip you in their synagogues;

title: Matthew 10:18
content: 18 and you will be brought also before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them and to the Gentiles.

title: Matthew 10:19
content: 19 But when they hand you over, do not worry about how or what you will speak, for what you will say will be given to you in that hour.

title: Matthew 10:20
content: 20 For you are not the one speaking, but the Spirit of your Father speaking through you.

title: Matthew 10:21
content: 21 Now brother will hand over brother to death, and a father, his child, and children will rise up against parents and put them to death.

title: Matthew 10:22
content: 22 And you will be hated by all because of my name, but the one having endured to the end, this one will be saved.

title: Matthew 10:23
content: 23 But whenever they persecute you in this city, flee to the next, for truly I say to you, you will certainly not finish the cities of Israel before the Son of Man comes.

title: Matthew 10:24
content: 24 A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a slave above his master.

title: Matthew 10:25
content: 25 It is enough for the disciple that he might be like his teacher, and the slave like his master. If they called the master of the house Beelzebul, how much worse the members of his household!

title: Matthew 10:26
content: 26 Therefore, do not fear them, for there is nothing concealed that will not be revealed, and hidden, that will not be made known.

title: Matthew 10:27
content: 27 What I tell you in the darkness, say in the light, and what you hear in your ear, proclaim upon the housetops.

title: Matthew 10:28
content: 28 And do not be afraid of the ones killing the body but not being able to kill the soul. But instead, fear the one being able to destroy both soul and body in Gehenna.

title: Matthew 10:29
content: 29 Are not two sparrows sold for an assarion? And yet not one of them will fall to the ground apart from your Father.

title: Matthew 10:30
content: 30 But even the hairs of your head are all numbered.

title: Matthew 10:31
content: 31 Therefore, do not fear; you are more valuable than many sparrows.

title: Matthew 10:32
content: 32 Therefore, everyone who will confess about me before men, I will also confess about him before my Father in the heavens.

title: Matthew 10:33
content: 33 But whoever denies me before men, I will also deny him before my Father in the heavens.

title: Matthew 10:34
content: 34 Do not think that I came to bring peace upon the earth. I did not come to bring peace, but a sword.

title: Matthew 10:35
content: 35 For I came to set a man against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law;

title: Matthew 10:36
content: 36 and the enemies of a man {will be} the ones of his household.

title: Matthew 10:37
content: 37 The one loving father or mother more than me is not worthy of me; and the one loving son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.

title: Matthew 10:38
content: 38 And whoever does not take up his cross and follow after me is not worthy of me.

title: Matthew 10:39
content: 39 The one having found his life will lose it, and the one having lost his life for my sake will find it.

title: Matthew 10:40
content: 40 The one receiving you receives me, and the one receiving me receives the one having sent me.

title: Matthew 10:41
content: 41 The one receiving a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a reward of a prophet, and the one receiving a righteous {man} in the name of a righteous {man} will receive a reward of a righteous {man}.

title: Matthew 10:42
content: 42 And whoever gives to one of these little ones a cup of cold water to drink only in the name of a disciple, truly I say to you, he will certainly not lose his reward.”

title: Matthew 11:1
content: 1 And it happened that when Jesus had finished giving orders to his 12 disciples, he departed from there to teach and to preach in their cities.

title: Matthew 11:2
content: 2 Now John, having heard in the prison about the deeds of Christ, having sent through his disciples,

title: Matthew 11:3
content: 3 said to him, “Are you the one coming, or should we expect another?”

title: Matthew 11:4
content: 4 And answering, Jesus said to them, “Having gone, report to John what you hear and see.

title: Matthew 11:5
content: 5 The blind see again, and the lame walk, lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, and the dead are raised, and the poor are being told the gospel.

title: Matthew 11:6
content: 6 And blessed is whoever is not caused to stumble on me.”

title: Matthew 11:7
content: 7 Now {as} these were going on their way, Jesus began to say to the crowds concerning John, “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

title: Matthew 11:8
content: 8 But what did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothing? Behold, the ones wearing soft clothing are in the houses of the kings.

title: Matthew 11:9
content: 9 But why did you go out? To see a prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet.

title: Matthew 11:10
content: 10 This is he concerning whom it is written, ‘Behold, I am sending my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’

title: Matthew 11:11
content: 11 Truly I say to you, among those born of women there has not arisen one greater than John the Baptist, but the least in the kingdom of the heavens is greater than he.

title: Matthew 11:12
content: 12 But from the days of John the Baptist until now, the kingdom of the heavens suffers violence, and violent men take it by force.

title: Matthew 11:13
content: 13 For all the Prophets and the Law have prophesied until John;

title: Matthew 11:14
content: 14 and if you are willing to accept {it}, he is Elijah, the one being about to come.

title: Matthew 11:15
content: 15 The one having ears to hear, let him hear.

title: Matthew 11:16
content: 16 Now to what will I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplace, who are calling out to the others,

title: Matthew 11:17
content: 17 saying, ‘We played a flute for you, and you did not dance. We sang a funeral song, and you did not mourn.’

title: Matthew 11:18
content: 18 For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon.’

title: Matthew 11:19
content: 19 The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Behold a man, a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom has been justified by her children.”

title: Matthew 11:20
content: 20 Then he began to rebuke the cities in which most of his miracles were done, because they had not repented.

title: Matthew 11:21
content: 21 “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles had happened in Tyre and Sidon which happened in you, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

title: Matthew 11:22
content: 22 Nevertheless, I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the day of judgment than for you.

title: Matthew 11:23
content: 23 And you, Capernaum, you will not be exalted to heaven, will you? You will be brought down as far as Hades. For if the miracles that happened in you had happened in Sodom, it would have remained until today.

title: Matthew 11:24
content: 24 Nevertheless, I say to you that it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment than for you.”

title: Matthew 11:25
content: 25 At that time, answering, Jesus said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you concealed these things from the wise and intelligent and revealed them to little children.

title: Matthew 11:26
content: 26 Yes, Father, for thus it was well-pleasing before you.

title: Matthew 11:27
content: 27 All things have been handed over to me by my Father; and no one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son, and to whomever the Son desires to reveal him.

title: Matthew 11:28
content: 28 Come to me, all the ones laboring and heavy burdened, and I will give you rest.

title: Matthew 11:29
content: 29 Take my yoke on you and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.

title: Matthew 11:30
content: 30 For my yoke {is} easy and my burden is light.”

title: Matthew 12:1
content: 1 At that time Jesus went on the Sabbaths through the grainfields, but his disciples were hungry and began to pick heads of grain and to eat {them}.

title: Matthew 12:2
content: 2 But the Pharisees, having seen this, said to him, “Behold, your disciples are doing what is not lawful to do on a Sabbath.”

title: Matthew 12:3
content: 3 But he said to them, “Have you not read what David did when he was hungry, and the ones with him—

title: Matthew 12:4
content: 4 how he went into the house of God and ate the loaves of the Presence, which was not lawful for him to eat nor for the ones with him, except only for the priests?

title: Matthew 12:5
content: 5 Or have you not read in the law that on the Sabbaths the priests in the temple profane the Sabbath, but are innocent?

title: Matthew 12:6
content: 6 But I say to you that something greater than the temple is here.

title: Matthew 12:7
content: 7 But if you had known what this is, ‘I desire mercy and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the innocent.

title: Matthew 12:8
content: 8 For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”

title: Matthew 12:9
content: 9 And having departed from there, he went into their synagogue.

title: Matthew 12:10
content: 10 And behold, a man having a withered hand, and they questioned him, saying, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbaths?” so that they might accuse him.

title: Matthew 12:11
content: 11 But he said to them, “What man will there be among you who will have one sheep, and if it might fall into a pit on the Sabbaths, will not grasp hold of it and lift {it} out?

title: Matthew 12:12
content: 12 How much more valuable, then, {is} a man than a sheep? Therefore, it is lawful to do good on the Sabbaths.”

title: Matthew 12:13
content: 13 Then he says to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And he stretched {it} out, and it was restored to health, just like the other.

title: Matthew 12:14
content: 14 But having gone out, the Pharisees took counsel against him so that they might destroy him.

title: Matthew 12:15
content: 15 But Jesus, having perceived this, withdrew from there. And many followed him, and he healed them all,

title: Matthew 12:16
content: 16 and he rebuked them so that they might not make him known,

title: Matthew 12:17
content: 17 so that it might be fulfilled what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,

title: Matthew 12:18
content: 18 “Behold, my servant whom I have chosen; my beloved, in whom my soul was well pleased. I will put my Spirit upon him, and he will announce justice to the Gentiles.

title: Matthew 12:19
content: 19 He will not strive nor cry aloud; neither will anyone hear his voice in the streets.

title: Matthew 12:20
content: 20 He will not break a bruised reed; and he will not quench a smoking flax, until he casts out justice to victory,

title: Matthew 12:21
content: 21 and in his name Gentiles will hope.”

title: Matthew 12:22
content: 22 Then one being demon-possessed was brought to him, blind and mute, and he healed him, so that the mute one spoke and saw.

title: Matthew 12:23
content: 23 And all the crowds were amazed and were saying, “Is this not the Son of David?”

title: Matthew 12:24
content: 24 But the Pharisees, having heard this, said, “He does not cast out demons except by Beelzebul, ruler of the demons.”

title: Matthew 12:25
content: 25 But having known their thoughts, he said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is made desolate, and every city or house divided against itself will not stand.

title: Matthew 12:26
content: 26 And if Satan casts out Satan, he has been divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?

title: Matthew 12:27
content: 27 And if I cast out the demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your sons cast them out? Because of this they will be your judges.

title: Matthew 12:28
content: 28 But if I cast out the demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.

title: Matthew 12:29
content: 29 Or how is anyone able to enter into the house of the strong man and steal his possessions if he has not first bound the strong man? And then he will plunder his house.

title: Matthew 12:30
content: 30 The one not being with me is against me, and the one not gathering with me scatters.

title: Matthew 12:31
content: 31 For this reason I say to you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy of the Spirit will not be forgiven.

title: Matthew 12:32
content: 32 And whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him. But whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven him, neither in this age, nor in the one coming.

title: Matthew 12:33
content: 33 Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or make the tree rotten and its fruit rotten, for the tree is known by its fruit.

title: Matthew 12:34
content: 34 You offspring of vipers, being evil, how are you able to say good things? For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.

title: Matthew 12:35
content: 35 The good man from his good treasure brings forth good things, and the evil man from his evil treasure brings forth evil things.

title: Matthew 12:36
content: 36 But I say to you that every careless word that men will speak, they will give an account concerning it in the day of judgment.

title: Matthew 12:37
content: 37 For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”

title: Matthew 12:38
content: 38 Then some of the scribes and Pharisees answered him, saying, “Teacher, we wish to see a sign from you.”

title: Matthew 12:39
content: 39 But answering, he said to them, “An evil and adulterous generation seeks a sign, but a sign will not be given to it except the sign of Jonah the prophet.

title: Matthew 12:40
content: 40 For just as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the big fish, in this manner the Son of Man will be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

title: Matthew 12:41
content: 41 The men of Nineveh will rise up in the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, something greater than Jonah {is} here.

title: Matthew 12:42
content: 42 The Queen of the South will stand up in the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and behold, something greater than Solomon {is} here.

title: Matthew 12:43
content: 43 Now when the unclean spirit has gone out from the man, it passes through waterless places seeking rest, and it does not find any.

title: Matthew 12:44
content: 44 Then it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came out.’ And having come, it finds {it} being empty, having been swept out and put in order.

title: Matthew 12:45
content: 45 Then it goes and takes along with itself seven other spirits more evil than itself and they having entered, it resides there. And the last things of that man become worse than the first things. Thus it will be also with this evil generation.”

title: Matthew 12:46
content: 46 {While} he was still speaking to the crowds, behold, his mother and brothers had stood outside, seeking to speak to him.

title: Matthew 12:47
content: 47 Now someone said to him, “Behold, your mother and your brothers have stood outside, seeking to speak to you.”

title: Matthew 12:48
content: 48 But answering, he said to the one speaking to him, “Who is my mother and who are my brothers?”

title: Matthew 12:49
content: 49 And having stretched out his hand toward his disciples, he said, “Behold, my mother and my brothers!

title: Matthew 12:50
content: 50 For whoever does the will of my Father in the heavens, he is my brother and sister and mother.”

title: Matthew 13:1
content: 1 On that day, Jesus, having gone out of the house, was sitting beside the sea.

title: Matthew 13:2
content: 2 And large crowds were gathered to him. As a result, having gotten into a boat, he sat down, and the whole crowd stood on the beach.

title: Matthew 13:3
content: 3 And he spoke many things to them in parables, saying, “Behold, the sower went out to sow.

title: Matthew 13:4
content: 4 And as he sowed, some fell beside the road, and the birds came and devoured them.

title: Matthew 13:5
content: 5 But others fell on the rocky ground, where it did not have much soil, and immediately it sprang up, because it did not have deep soil.

title: Matthew 13:6
content: 6 But {when} the sun had risen, it was scorched, and because it had no root, it withered.

title: Matthew 13:7
content: 7 But others fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked them.

title: Matthew 13:8
content: 8 But others fell on good soil and were giving fruit, some 100, and some 60, and some 30.

title: Matthew 13:9
content: 9 The one having ears, let him hear.”

title: Matthew 13:10
content: 10 And having approached, the disciples said to him, “For what reason do you speak to them in parables?”

title: Matthew 13:11
content: 11 But he, answering, said to them, “To you has been given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of the heavens, but to those it has not been given.

title: Matthew 13:12
content: 12 For whoever has, it will be given to him, and he will have an abundance. But whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.

title: Matthew 13:13
content: 13 For this reason I speak to them in parables; because seeing, they do not see; and hearing, they do not hear nor understand.

title: Matthew 13:14
content: 14 And in them the prophecy of Isaiah is being fulfilled, which says, ‘In hearing you will hear, but you will certainly not understand; and seeing, you will see, but you will certainly not perceive.

title: Matthew 13:15
content: 15 For the heart of this people has been thickened, and with {their} ears they have hardly heard, and they have shut their eyes, lest they might see with {their} eyes, and they might hear with {their} ears, and they might understand with {their} heart and turn back, and I would heal them.’

title: Matthew 13:16
content: 16 But blessed {are} your eyes, for they see; and your ears, for they hear.

title: Matthew 13:17
content: 17 For truly I say to you that many prophets and righteous ones longed to see what you see, and did not see, and to hear what you hear, and did not hear.

title: Matthew 13:18
content: 18 You, therefore, listen to the parable of the sower.

title: Matthew 13:19
content: 19 Everyone hearing the word of the kingdom and not understanding, the evil one comes and snatches away {what} had been sown in his heart. This is {what} was sown beside the road.

title: Matthew 13:20
content: 20 Now the one having been sown on the rocky ground, this is the one hearing the word and immediately receiving it with joy;

title: Matthew 13:21
content: 21 but he has no root in himself but is temporary; and tribulation or persecution having happened because of the word, immediately he is caused to stumble.

title: Matthew 13:22
content: 22 Now the one having been sown among the thorns, this is the one hearing the word, but the worry of this age and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.

title: Matthew 13:23
content: 23 Now the one having been sown on the good soil, this is the one hearing the word and understanding {it}, who indeed bears fruit and yields, some 100, and some 60, and some 30.”

title: Matthew 13:24
content: 24 He set before them another parable, saying, “The kingdom of the heavens is compared to a man having sown good seed in his field.

title: Matthew 13:25
content: 25 But while the men slept, his enemy came and sowed darnel among the wheat and went away.

title: Matthew 13:26
content: 26 Now when the blades sprouted and produced a crop, then the darnel became visible also.

title: Matthew 13:27
content: 27 Now the servants of the master of the house, having approached, said to him, ‘Master, did you not sow good seed in your field? From where then does it have darnel?’

title: Matthew 13:28
content: 28 But he was saying to them, ‘A hostile man did this.’ But the servants say to him, ‘Do you therefore desire that, having gone out, we would gather them?’

title: Matthew 13:29
content: 29 But he says, ‘Certainly not, lest gathering the darnel, you might uproot the wheat along with them.

title: Matthew 13:30
content: 30 Permit both to grow together until the harvest, and at the time of the harvest I will say to the reapers, “First gather the darnel and tie them in bundles to burn them up but gather the wheat into my barn.”’”

title: Matthew 13:31
content: 31 He set before them another parable, saying, “The kingdom of the heavens is like a mustard seed which, having taken, a man sowed in his field;

title: Matthew 13:32
content: 32 which is indeed the smallest of all the seeds, but when it grows, it is greater than the vegetable plants and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the sky come and nest in its branches.”

title: Matthew 13:33
content: 33 He spoke to them another parable: “The kingdom of the heavens is like yeast that a woman, having taken, mixed with three seahs of flour until it was all leavened.”

title: Matthew 13:34
content: 34 All these things Jesus spoke in parables to the crowds, and he was speaking nothing to them without a parable,

title: Matthew 13:35
content: 35 so that {what} had been said through the prophet might be fulfilled, saying, “I will open my mouth in parables. I will declare {what} has been hidden from the foundation of the world.”

title: Matthew 13:36
content: 36 Then, having left the crowds, he went into the house. And his disciples approached him, saying, “Explain to us the parable of the darnel of the field.”

title: Matthew 13:37
content: 37 Now answering, he said, “The one sowing the good seed is the Son of Man,

title: Matthew 13:38
content: 38 and the field is the world, and the good seed—these are the sons of the kingdom. And the darnel are the sons of the evil one,

title: Matthew 13:39
content: 39 and the enemy having sowed them is the devil. And the harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.

title: Matthew 13:40
content: 40 Therefore, just as the darnel are gathered and burned with fire, thus it will be at the end of the age.

title: Matthew 13:41
content: 41 The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will gather from his kingdom all the stumbling blocks and the ones doing lawlessness.

title: Matthew 13:42
content: 42 And they will throw them into the furnace of fire, where there will be weeping and grinding of the teeth.

title: Matthew 13:43
content: 43 Then the righteous will shine as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. The one having ears, let him hear.

title: Matthew 13:44
content: 44 The kingdom of the heavens is like a treasure hidden in a field, which, having found, a man hid. And from his joy, he goes and sells everything, as much as he has, and buys that field.

title: Matthew 13:45
content: 45 Again, the kingdom of the heavens is like a man, a merchant, seeking fine pearls.

title: Matthew 13:46
content: 46 And having found one very valuable pearl, having gone away, he sold everything, as much as he had, and bought it.

title: Matthew 13:47
content: 47 Again, the kingdom of the heavens is like a net having been cast into the sea, and having gathered from every kind,

title: Matthew 13:48
content: 48 which, when it was filled, having dragged onto the beach, and having sat down, they gathered the good things into containers, but the rotten things they threw out.

title: Matthew 13:49
content: 49 Thus it will be at the end of the age: The angels will go out and will separate the wicked from among the righteous,

title: Matthew 13:50
content: 50 and they will throw them into the furnace of fire, where there will be weeping and grinding of the teeth.

title: Matthew 13:51
content: 51 Have you understood all these things?” They say to him, “Yes.”

title: Matthew 13:52
content: 52 Now he said to them, “For this reason, every scribe having been discipled for the kingdom of the heavens is like a man, the master of the house, who brings forth new and old from his treasure.”

title: Matthew 13:53
content: 53 And it happened that when Jesus finished these parables, he departed from there.

title: Matthew 13:54
content: 54 And having come to his hometown, he was teaching them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished and say, “From where to this one {is} this wisdom and these miracles?

title: Matthew 13:55
content: 55 Is not this the son of the carpenter? Is not his mother called Mary, and his brothers, James and Joseph and Simon and Judas?

title: Matthew 13:56
content: 56 And are not all his sisters with us? From where, therefore, to this one {are} all these things?”

title: Matthew 13:57
content: 57 And they were being caused to stumble on him. But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his hometown and in his house.”

title: Matthew 13:58
content: 58 And he did not do many miracles there, because of their unbelief.

title: Matthew 14:1
content: 1 At that time, Herod the tetrarch heard the news about Jesus.

title: Matthew 14:2
content: 2 And he said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist. He has been raised from the dead, and because of this the powers work in him.”

title: Matthew 14:3
content: 3 For Herod, having seized John, bound him and put him in prison because of Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip.

title: Matthew 14:4
content: 4 For John was saying to him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”

title: Matthew 14:5
content: 5 And wanting to put him to death, he feared the crowd, because they were regarding him as a prophet.

title: Matthew 14:6
content: 6 But the birthday of Herod having come, the daughter of Herodias danced in the midst and pleased Herod,

title: Matthew 14:7
content: 7 because of which he promised with an oath to give her whatever she asked.

title: Matthew 14:8
content: 8 Now she, having been urged beforehand by her mother, said, “Give me here, on a platter, the head of John the Baptist.”

title: Matthew 14:9
content: 9 And the king was grieved, {but} because of the oaths and the ones reclining to eat with him, he commanded {it} to be given.

title: Matthew 14:10
content: 10 And having sent, he beheaded John in the prison.

title: Matthew 14:11
content: 11 And his head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought {it} to her mother.

title: Matthew 14:12
content: 12 And having approached, his disciples took away the corpse and buried him. And having come, they reported {this} to Jesus.

title: Matthew 14:13
content: 13 Now having heard, Jesus withdrew from there in a boat to a desolate place by himself. And having heard, the crowds followed him on foot from the cities.

title: Matthew 14:14
content: 14 And having come out, he saw a large crowd, and he had compassion on them and healed their sick.

title: Matthew 14:15
content: 15 Now evening having come, the disciples came to him, saying, “This place is desolate, and the hour has already passed by. Send the crowds away so that, having gone away to the villages, they might buy food for themselves.”

title: Matthew 14:16
content: 16 But Jesus said to them, “They have no need to go away. You give them to eat.”

title: Matthew 14:17
content: 17 But they say to him, “We have nothing here except five loaves and two fish.”

title: Matthew 14:18
content: 18 But he said, “Bring them here to me.”

title: Matthew 14:19
content: 19 And having commanded the crowds to recline on the grass, having taken the five loaves and the two fish, having looked up to heaven, he blessed, and having broken {them}, he gave the loaves to the disciples, and the disciples to the crowds.

title: Matthew 14:20
content: 20 And they all ate and were satisfied. And they took up the remaining of the broken pieces—12 baskets full.

title: Matthew 14:21
content: 21 Now the ones eating were about 5,000 men, besides women and children.

title: Matthew 14:22
content: 22 And immediately he compelled the disciples to get into the boat and to go before him to the other side, while he sent the crowds away.

title: Matthew 14:23
content: 23 And having sent the crowds away, he went up on the mountain by himself to pray. Now evening having come, he was there alone.

title: Matthew 14:24
content: 24 But the boat was already in the middle of the sea, being tormented by the waves, for the wind was against {it}.

title: Matthew 14:25
content: 25 Now in the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea.

title: Matthew 14:26
content: 26 But the disciples, having seen him walking on the sea, were greatly troubled, saying, “It is a ghost,” and they cried out from fear.

title: Matthew 14:27
content: 27 But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying, “Take courage! It is I! Do not be afraid.”

title: Matthew 14:28
content: 28 But answering him, Peter said, “Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the water.”

title: Matthew 14:29
content: 29 And he said, “Come.” And Peter, having gotten out from the boat, walked on the water to go to Jesus.

title: Matthew 14:30
content: 30 But seeing the strong wind, he became afraid, and having begun to sink, he cried out, saying, “Lord, save me!”

title: Matthew 14:31
content: 31 But immediately, Jesus, having stretched out his hand, took hold of him, and says to him, “You of little faith, why did you doubt?”

title: Matthew 14:32
content: 32 And {when} they had gotten into the boat, the wind ceased.

title: Matthew 14:33
content: 33 And the ones in the boat worshiped him, saying, “Truly you are the Son of God.”

title: Matthew 14:34
content: 34 And having crossed over, they came to the land at Gennesaret.

title: Matthew 14:35
content: 35 And having recognized him, the men of that place sent into all that surrounding area, and they brought to him all the ones having sickness.

title: Matthew 14:36
content: 36 And they were begging him so that they might only touch the edge of his garment, and as many as touched {it} were healed.

title: Matthew 15:1
content: 1 Then Pharisees and scribes come to Jesus from Jerusalem, saying,

title: Matthew 15:2
content: 2 “Why do your disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat bread.”

title: Matthew 15:3
content: 3 But he, answering, said to them, “Why do you also transgress the commandment of God because of your tradition?

title: Matthew 15:4
content: 4 For God commanded, saying, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and ‘The one speaking evil of his father or mother, let him end in death.’

title: Matthew 15:5
content: 5 But you say, ‘Whoever says to his father or mother, “Whatever you might have benefited from me {is} a gift,”

title: Matthew 15:6
content: 6 he will certainly not honor his father.’ And you have set aside the word of God because of your tradition.

title: Matthew 15:7
content: 7 Hypocrites! Isaiah prophesied well about you, saying,

title: Matthew 15:8
content: 8 ‘This people honors me with their lips, but their heart is far away from me.

title: Matthew 15:9
content: 9 But they worship me in vain, teaching as doctrines commandments of men.’”

title: Matthew 15:10
content: 10 And having summoned the crowd, he said to them, “Listen and understand:

title: Matthew 15:11
content: 11 What enters into the mouth does not defile the man, but what comes out from the mouth, this defiles the man.”

title: Matthew 15:12
content: 12 Then having approached, the disciples said to him, “Do you know that the Pharisees, having heard this word, were caused to stumble?”

title: Matthew 15:13
content: 13 But he, answering, said, “Every plant that my heavenly Father has not planted will be uprooted.

title: Matthew 15:14
content: 14 Leave them! They are blind guides. But if a blind one guides a blind one, both will fall into a pit.”

title: Matthew 15:15
content: 15 But answering, Peter said to him, “Explain the parable to us.”

title: Matthew 15:16
content: 16 But he said, “Are you also still without understanding?

title: Matthew 15:17
content: 17 Do you not yet understand that everything that enters into the mouth passes into the stomach and is passed out into the latrine?

title: Matthew 15:18
content: 18 But the things coming out from the mouth come from the heart, and those defile the man.

title: Matthew 15:19
content: 19 For from the heart come evil thoughts, murders, adultery, sexual immorality, thefts, false testimony, blasphemies.

title: Matthew 15:20
content: 20 These are the things defiling the man, but to eat with unwashed hands does not defile the man.”

title: Matthew 15:21
content: 21 And having come out from there, Jesus withdrew into the regions of Tyre and Sidon.

title: Matthew 15:22
content: 22 And behold, a Canaanite woman, having come out from those regions, was crying out, saying, “Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter is severely demon-possessed.”

title: Matthew 15:23
content: 23 But he did not answer her a word. And having approached, his disciples were begging him, saying, “Send her away, for she is crying out after us.”

title: Matthew 15:24
content: 24 But he, answering, said, “I was not sent, except to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”

title: Matthew 15:25
content: 25 But she, having come, bowed down to him, saying, “Lord, help me.”

title: Matthew 15:26
content: 26 Now he, answering, said, “It is not good to take the bread of the children and to throw {it} to the little dogs.”

title: Matthew 15:27
content: 27 But she said, “Yes, Lord, for also the little dogs eat from the crumbs falling from the table of their masters.”

title: Matthew 15:28
content: 28 Then answering, Jesus said to her, “O woman, great {is} your faith; let it be done for you just as you desire.” And her daughter was healed from that hour.

title: Matthew 15:29
content: 29 And having left from there, Jesus went along the Sea of Galilee, and having gone up on a mountain, he was sitting there.

title: Matthew 15:30
content: 30 And large crowds approached him, having with them the lame, the blind, the crippled, the mute, and many others. And they laid them at his feet, and he healed them,

title: Matthew 15:31
content: 31 so that the crowd marveled, seeing the mute speaking, the crippled healthy, and the lame walking, and the blind seeing, and they glorified the God of Israel.

title: Matthew 15:32
content: 32 But Jesus, having summoned his disciples, said, “I have compassion on the crowd, because they are remaining with me already three days and do not have anything {that} they might eat. And I do not want to send them away hungry, lest they might faint on the way.”

title: Matthew 15:33
content: 33 And the disciples say to him, “From where {would be} to us in a desolate place so many loaves so as to satisfy so large a crowd?”

title: Matthew 15:34
content: 34 And Jesus says to them, “How many loaves do you have?” And they said, “Seven, and a few small fish.”

title: Matthew 15:35
content: 35 And having commanded the crowd to recline on the ground,

title: Matthew 15:36
content: 36 he took the seven loaves and the fish, and having given thanks, he broke {them} and was giving {them} to the disciples, and the disciples to the crowds.

title: Matthew 15:37
content: 37 And they all ate and were satisfied. And they took up the remaining of the broken pieces—seven baskets full.

title: Matthew 15:38
content: 38 But those eating were 4,000 men, besides women and children.

title: Matthew 15:39
content: 39 And having sent away the crowds, he got into the boat and went into the regions of Magadan.

title: Matthew 16:1
