content: 1 And the Pharisees and Sadducees, having approached, testing {him}, asked him to show them a sign from heaven.

title: Matthew 16:2
content: 2 But he answering said to them, “[Evening having come, you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.’

title: Matthew 16:3
content: 3 And in early morning, ‘Today will be stormy, for the sky is red, being overcast.’ You know to interpret the face of the sky, but the signs of the times you are not able.]

title: Matthew 16:4
content: 4 An evil and adulterous generation seeks a sign, but a sign will not be given to it except the sign of Jonah.” And having left them, he went away.

title: Matthew 16:5
content: 5 And the disciples, having come to the other side, forgot to take loaves.

title: Matthew 16:6
content: 6 Now Jesus said to them, “See and guard from the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”

title: Matthew 16:7
content: 7 But they were reasoning among themselves, saying, “{It is} because we did not take loaves.”

title: Matthew 16:8
content: 8 But having known this, Jesus said, “You of little faith, why are you reasoning among yourselves that you do not have loaves?

title: Matthew 16:9
content: 9 Do you not yet perceive nor remember the five loaves of the 5,000, and how many baskets you received?

title: Matthew 16:10
content: 10 Nor the seven loaves of the 4,000, and how many baskets you received?

title: Matthew 16:11
content: 11 How do you not perceive that I did not speak to you about loaves? But guard from the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”

title: Matthew 16:12
content: 12 Then they understood that he had not told them to guard from the yeast of loaves, but from the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

title: Matthew 16:13
content: 13 Now Jesus, having come to the regions of Caesarea Philippi, asked his disciples, saying, “Who do men say the Son of Man is?”

title: Matthew 16:14
content: 14 And they said, “Some, John the Baptist; and some, Elijah; and others, Jeremiah, or one of the prophets.”

title: Matthew 16:15
content: 15 He says to them, “But who do you say I am?”

title: Matthew 16:16
content: 16 And answering, Simon Peter said, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”

title: Matthew 16:17
content: 17 Now answering, Jesus said to him, “Blessed are you, Simon Bar Jonah, because flesh and blood did not reveal this to you, but my Father in the heavens.

title: Matthew 16:18
content: 18 And I also say to you that you are Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church, and the gates of Hades will not prevail against it.

title: Matthew 16:19
content: 19 I will give to you the keys of the kingdom of the heavens, and whatever you bind on the earth will have been bound in the heavens, and whatever you loose on the earth will have been loosed in the heavens.”

title: Matthew 16:20
content: 20 Then he commanded the disciples that they tell no one that he is the Christ.

title: Matthew 16:21
content: 21 From that time Jesus Christ began to show to his disciples that it is necessary for him to go to Jerusalem and to suffer much from the elders and chief priests and scribes and to be killed and to be raised on the third day.

title: Matthew 16:22
content: 22 And having taken him aside, Peter began to rebuke him, saying, “Merciful to you, Lord; this will certainly not be to you.”

title: Matthew 16:23
content: 23 But, he, having turned, said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me, because you are not considering the things of God, but the things of men.”

title: Matthew 16:24
content: 24 Then Jesus said to his disciples, “If anyone wants to come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.

title: Matthew 16:25
content: 25 For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake will find it.

title: Matthew 16:26
content: 26 For what will a man benefit if he gains the whole world but forfeits his life? Or what will a man give in exchange for his life?

title: Matthew 16:27
content: 27 For the Son of Man is about to come in the glory of his Father with his angels. And then he will repay each one according to his action.

title: Matthew 16:28
content: 28 Truly I say to you that there are some of the ones standing here who will certainly not taste death until they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom.”

title: Matthew 17:1
content: 1 And after six days, Jesus takes along Peter, and James, and John his brother, and brings them up onto a high mountain by themselves.

title: Matthew 17:2
content: 2 And he was transfigured before them, and his face shone as the sun, and his garments became white as the light.

title: Matthew 17:3
content: 3 And behold, Moses and Elijah were seen by them, talking with him.

title: Matthew 17:4
content: 4 And answering, Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you wish, I will make here three tents, one for you, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”

title: Matthew 17:5
content: 5 {While} he was still speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them, and behold, a voice from the cloud, saying, “This is my beloved Son with whom I am well pleased. Listen to him.”

title: Matthew 17:6
content: 6 And having heard, the disciples fell on their face and were very afraid.

title: Matthew 17:7
content: 7 And Jesus approached and having touched them, said, “Get up and do not be afraid.”

title: Matthew 17:8
content: 8 But having lifted up their eyes, they saw no one except only Jesus himself.

title: Matthew 17:9
content: 9 And {as} they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying, “Tell the vision to no one until the Son of Man might have risen from the dead.”

title: Matthew 17:10
content: 10 And his disciples questioned him, saying, “Why then do the scribes say that it is necessary for Elijah to come first?”

title: Matthew 17:11
content: 11 But he, answering, said, “Elijah indeed comes and will restore all things.

title: Matthew 17:12
content: 12 But I say to you that Elijah already came, and they did not recognize him, but they did to him whatever they wanted. In the same way also, the Son of Man is about to suffer by them.”

title: Matthew 17:13
content: 13 Then the disciples understood that he spoke to them about John the Baptist.

title: Matthew 17:14
content: 14 And having come to the crowd, a man approached him, kneeling before him

title: Matthew 17:15
content: 15 and saying, “Lord, have mercy on my son, because he is epileptic and has sickness, for he often falls into the fire and often into the water.

title: Matthew 17:16
content: 16 And I brought him to your disciples, and they were not able to heal him.”

title: Matthew 17:17
content: 17 But answering, Jesus said, “O unbelieving and perverted generation, until when will I be with you? Until when will I bear with you? Bring him here to me.”

title: Matthew 17:18
content: 18 And Jesus rebuked it, and the demon came out from him, and the boy was healed from that hour.

title: Matthew 17:19
content: 19 Then the disciples, having approached Jesus privately, said, “For what reason were we not able to cast it out?”

title: Matthew 17:20
content: 20 And he says to them, “Because of your little faith. For truly I say to you, if you had faith like a mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move, and nothing will be impossible for you.

title: Matthew 17:21
content: 21 [But this kind does not go out except by prayer and fasting.]”

title: Matthew 17:22
content: 22 Now they being gathered together in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is about to be handed over into the hands of men,

title: Matthew 17:23
content: 23 and they will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised up.” And they were very grieved.

title: Matthew 17:24
content: 24 Now {when} they had come to Capernaum, the ones collecting the two-drachma tax approached Peter and said, “Does not your teacher pay the two-drachma tax?”

title: Matthew 17:25
content: 25 He says, “Yes.” And having entered into the house, Jesus anticipated him, saying, “What do you think, Simon? The kings of the earth—from whom do they receive taxes or tolls? From their sons or from strangers?”

title: Matthew 17:26
content: 26 But having said, “From strangers,” Jesus said to him, “Therefore, the sons are free.

title: Matthew 17:27
content: 27 But in order that we might not cause them to stumble, having gone to the sea, throw in a fishhook, and draw in the first fish having come up. And having opened its mouth, you will find a shekel. Having taken that, give {it} to them on behalf of me and you.”

title: Matthew 18:1
content: 1 At that hour the disciples approached Jesus, saying, “Who then is greatest in the kingdom of the heavens?”

title: Matthew 18:2
content: 2 And having summoned a little child, he set him in the midst of them

title: Matthew 18:3
content: 3 and said, “Truly I say to you, unless you turn and become like little children, you will certainly not enter into the kingdom of the heavens.

title: Matthew 18:4
content: 4 Therefore, whoever will humble himself like this little child, he is the greatest in the kingdom of the heavens.

title: Matthew 18:5
content: 5 And whoever receives a little child like this in my name receives me.

title: Matthew 18:6
content: 6 But whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it is better for him that a millstone of a donkey would have been hung around his neck and he would have been sunk into the depth of the sea.

title: Matthew 18:7
content: 7 Woe to the world because of the stumbling blocks! For it is necessary that the stumbling blocks come, but woe to the man through whom the stumbling block comes!

title: Matthew 18:8
content: 8 Now if your hand or your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off and throw {it} away from you. It is better for you to enter into life crippled or lame than, having two hands or two feet, to be thrown into the eternal fire.

title: Matthew 18:9
content: 9 And if your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out and throw {it} away from you. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye than, having two eyes, to be thrown into the Gehenna of fire.

title: Matthew 18:10
content: 10 See that you would not despise one of these little ones. For I say to you that in heaven their angels always look on the face of my Father in the heavens.

title: Matthew 18:11
content: 11 [For the Son of Man came to save the one that has been lost.]

title: Matthew 18:12
content: 12 What do you think? If a certain man has 100 sheep, and one of them goes astray, having left the 99 on the mountains and having gone, does he not seek the one having gone astray?

title: Matthew 18:13
content: 13 And if he happens to find it, truly I say to you that he rejoices over it more than over the 99 that have not gone astray.

title: Matthew 18:14
content: 14 In the same way, it is not the will before your Father in the heavens that one of these little ones would perish.

title: Matthew 18:15
content: 15 But if your brother sins against you, go, reprove him between you and him alone. If he listens to you, you have gained your brother.

title: Matthew 18:16
content: 16 But if he does not listen, take with you yet one or two {others}, so that ‘by the mouth of two or three witnesses every word might be verified.’

title: Matthew 18:17
content: 17 But if he refuses to listen to them, speak to the church. But if he also refuses to listen to the church, let him be to you even as the Gentile and the tax collector.

title: Matthew 18:18
content: 18 Truly I say to you, whatever you bind on the earth will be bound in heaven; and whatever you release on the earth will be released in heaven.

title: Matthew 18:19
content: 19 Again, truly I say to you that if two of you agree together on the earth about any matter, whatever they might ask, it will be done for them by my Father in the heavens.

title: Matthew 18:20
content: 20 For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there I am in their midst.”

title: Matthew 18:21
content: 21 Then having approached, Peter said to him, “Lord, how often will my brother sin against me and I will forgive him? Until seven times?”

title: Matthew 18:22
content: 22 Jesus says to him, “I do not say to you up to seven times, but up to 77 times.

title: Matthew 18:23
content: 23 For this reason, the kingdom of the heavens is compared to a man, a king, who wanted to take up a word together with his slaves.

title: Matthew 18:24
content: 24 Now {when} he had begun to take up together, one debtor of 10,000 talents was brought to him.

title: Matthew 18:25
content: 25 But, he not being able to repay, the master commanded him to be sold, together with his wife and children and everything, as much as he had, and repayment to be made.

title: Matthew 18:26
content: 26 So, having fallen down, the slave was bowing down before him, saying, ‘Master, have patience with me, and I will repay you everything.’

title: Matthew 18:27
content: 27 Now having had compassion, the master of that slave released him and forgave him the debt.

title: Matthew 18:28
content: 28 But having gone out, that slave found one of his fellow slaves, who owed him 100 denarii, and having seized him, he choked {him}, saying, ‘Repay whatever you owe.’

title: Matthew 18:29
content: 29 So, having fallen down, his fellow slave begged him, saying, ‘Have patience with me, and I will repay you.’

title: Matthew 18:30
content: 30 But he was not willing. Instead, having gone away, he threw him into prison until he might repay {what} is owed.

title: Matthew 18:31
content: 31 Therefore, his fellow slaves, having seen {what} had happened, were very grieved. And having come, they explained to their master everything that had happened.

title: Matthew 18:32
content: 32 Then, having summoned him, his master says to him, ‘Wicked slave, I forgave you all that debt because you begged me.

title: Matthew 18:33
content: 33 Was it not necessary for you also to have had mercy on your fellow slave, just as I also had mercy on you?’

title: Matthew 18:34
content: 34 And having become angry, his master handed him over to the torturers until he would repay all that is owed.

title: Matthew 18:35
content: 35 Thus also my heavenly Father will do to you, if each of you does not forgive his brother out of your hearts.”

title: Matthew 19:1
content: 1 And it happened that when Jesus had finished these words, he departed from Galilee and came to the regions of Judea beyond the Jordan.

title: Matthew 19:2
content: 2 And great crowds followed him, and he healed them there.

title: Matthew 19:3
content: 3 And Pharisees approached him, testing him, and saying whether it is lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any reason.

title: Matthew 19:4
content: 4 But he, answering, said, “Have you not read that the one having made {them} from the beginning ‘made them male and female,’

title: Matthew 19:5
content: 5 and said, ‘Because of this, a man will leave his father and mother and will be joined to his wife, and the two will be one flesh’?

title: Matthew 19:6
content: 6 So then, they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore, what God joined together, let man not separate.”

title: Matthew 19:7
content: 7 They say to him, “Why then did Moses command {us} to give a certificate of divorce and to divorce her?”

title: Matthew 19:8
content: 8 He says to them, “Because of your hardness of heart, Moses allowed you to divorce your wives, but from the beginning it was not that way.

title: Matthew 19:9
content: 9 But I say to you that whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another, commits adultery; and the one having married one that has been divorced commits adultery.”

title: Matthew 19:10
content: 10 The disciples say to him, “If thus is the reason of the man with his wife, it is better not to marry.”

title: Matthew 19:11
content: 11 But he said to them, “Not all receive this word, but to whom it has been given.

title: Matthew 19:12
content: 12 For there are eunuchs who were born thus from their mother’s womb, and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men, and there are eunuchs who made themselves eunuchs because of the kingdom of the heavens. The one being able to receive {this}, let him receive {it}.”

title: Matthew 19:13
content: 13 Then little children were brought to him so that he would lay his hands on them and would pray, but the disciples rebuked them.

title: Matthew 19:14
content: 14 But Jesus said, “Permit the little children, and do not forbid them to come to me, for of the ones such as these is the kingdom of the heavens.”

title: Matthew 19:15
content: 15 And having laid his hands on them, he went from there.

title: Matthew 19:16
content: 16 And behold, one, having approached him, said, “Teacher, what good thing should I do in order that I might have eternal life?”

title: Matthew 19:17
content: 17 But he said to him, “Why do you ask me about {what is} good? One is good, but if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments.”

title: Matthew 19:18
content: 18 He says to him, “Which ones?” And Jesus said, “Do not kill, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not testify falsely,

title: Matthew 19:19
content: 19 honor your father and your mother, and love your neighbor as yourself.”

title: Matthew 19:20
content: 20 The young man says to him, “All these things I have kept. What do I still lack?”

title: Matthew 19:21
content: 21 Jesus said to him, “If you want to be perfect, go, sell your possessions, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in the heavens; and come, follow me.”

title: Matthew 19:22
content: 22 But the young man, having heard the word, went away being grieved, for he was having many possessions.

title: Matthew 19:23
content: 23 Now Jesus said to his disciples, “Truly I say to you, a rich {person} will enter difficultly into the kingdom of the heavens.

title: Matthew 19:24
content: 24 And again I say to you, it is easier for a camel to pass through an eye of a needle than for a rich {person} to enter into the kingdom of God.”

title: Matthew 19:25
content: 25 Now having heard this, the disciples were very astonished, saying, “Who then is able to be saved?”

title: Matthew 19:26
content: 26 But Jesus, having looked at {them}, said to them, “With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”

title: Matthew 19:27
content: 27 Then answering, Peter said to him, “Behold, we left everything and followed you. What then will there be for us?”

title: Matthew 19:28
content: 28 And Jesus said to them, “Truly I say to you that in the renewal when the Son of Man sits on his throne of glory, you, the ones having followed me, you also will sit upon 12 thrones, judging the 12 tribes of Israel.

title: Matthew 19:29
content: 29 And everyone who has left houses, or brothers, or sisters, or a father, or a mother, or a wife, or children, or lands for the sake of my name, will receive 100 times {as much} and will inherit eternal life.

title: Matthew 19:30
content: 30 But many first will be last, and last, first.

title: Matthew 20:1
content: 1 For the kingdom of the heavens is like a man, the master of the house, who went out with the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.

title: Matthew 20:2
content: 2 Now having agreed with the workers for a denarius for the day, he sent them into his vineyard.

title: Matthew 20:3
content: 3 And having gone out about the third hour, he saw others standing idle in the marketplace.

title: Matthew 20:4
content: 4 And to them he said, ‘You also, go into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will give you.’

title: Matthew 20:5
content: 5 So they went out. Having gone out again about the sixth and ninth hour, he did likewise.

title: Matthew 20:6
content: 6 Now having gone out about the eleventh {hour}, he found others standing, and he says to them, ‘Why have you stood here idle the whole day?’

title: Matthew 20:7
content: 7 They say to him, ‘Because no one hired us.’ He says to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard.’

title: Matthew 20:8
content: 8 And evening having come, the owner of the vineyard says to his manager, ‘Call the workers and pay them their wages, having begun from the last to the first.’

title: Matthew 20:9
content: 9 And having come, the ones about the eleventh hour each received a denarius.

title: Matthew 20:10
content: 10 But having come, the first thought that they will receive more, but they also received a denarius each.

title: Matthew 20:11
content: 11 But having received {it}, they were murmuring against the master of the house,

title: Matthew 20:12
content: 12 saying, ‘These last ones have done one hour, but you made them equal to us, the ones having borne the burden of the day and the scorching heat.’

title: Matthew 20:13
content: 13 But he, answering, said to one of them, ‘Friend, I am not wronging you. Did you not agree with me for a denarius?

title: Matthew 20:14
content: 14 Take {what is} yours and go away. But I desire to give to this last as also to you.

title: Matthew 20:15
content: 15 Or is it not lawful for me to do what I desire with {what is} mine? Or is your eye evil because I am good?’

title: Matthew 20:16
content: 16 In the same way, the last will be first, and the first last.”

title: Matthew 20:17
content: 17 And Jesus, going up to Jerusalem, took the 12 disciples aside by themselves, and on the way he said to them,

title: Matthew 20:18
content: 18 “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and scribes, and they will condemn him to death

title: Matthew 20:19
content: 19 and hand him over to the Gentiles for them to mock and to whip and to crucify him. But on the third day he will be raised up.”

title: Matthew 20:20
content: 20 Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee approached him with her sons, bowing down and asking for something from him.

title: Matthew 20:21
content: 21 And he said to her, “What do you desire?” She says to him, “Say that these two sons of mine might sit, one at your right hand and one at your left hand, in your kingdom.”

title: Matthew 20:22
content: 22 But answering, Jesus said, “You do not know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink?” They say to him, “We are able.”

title: Matthew 20:23
content: 23 He says to them, “My cup you will drink. But to sit at my right hand and at my left hand is not mine to give, but for whom it has been prepared by my Father.”

title: Matthew 20:24
content: 24 And having heard this, the ten were very angry with the two brothers.

title: Matthew 20:25
content: 25 But Jesus, having summoned them, said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and the great ones exercise authority over them.

title: Matthew 20:26
content: 26 It is not this way among you. Instead, whoever desires to become great among you will be your servant,

title: Matthew 20:27
content: 27 and whoever desires to be first among you will be your slave,

title: Matthew 20:28
content: 28 just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom in exchange for many.”

title: Matthew 20:29
content: 29 And {as} they were going out from Jericho, a great crowd followed him.

title: Matthew 20:30
content: 30 And behold, two blind men, sitting beside the road, having heard that Jesus is passing by, cried out, saying, “Have mercy on us, Lord, Son of David.”

title: Matthew 20:31
content: 31 Now the crowd rebuked them, so that they would be silent, but they cried out even more, saying, “Lord, have mercy on us, Son of David.”

title: Matthew 20:32
content: 32 And having stood still, Jesus called them and said, “What do you desire {that} I might do for you?”

title: Matthew 20:33
content: 33 They say to him, “Lord, that our eyes might be opened.”

title: Matthew 20:34
content: 34 Now having had compassion, Jesus touched their eyes. And immediately they saw again, and they followed him.

title: Matthew 21:1
content: 1 And when they came near to Jerusalem and came to Bethphage, to the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,

title: Matthew 21:2
content: 2 saying to them, “Go into the village opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied up, and a colt with her. Having untied {them}, bring {them} to me.

title: Matthew 21:3
content: 3 And if anyone says anything to you, you will say, ‘The Lord has need of them,’ and immediately he will send them.”

title: Matthew 21:4
content: 4 Now this happened so that {what} was spoken through the prophet might be fulfilled, saying,

title: Matthew 21:5
content: 5 “Tell the daughter of Zion, ‘Behold, your King is coming to you, humble and riding on a donkey, and on a colt, a son of a beast of burden.’”

title: Matthew 21:6
content: 6 Now the disciples, having gone and having done just as Jesus had directed them,

title: Matthew 21:7
content: 7 brought the donkey and the colt and put their cloaks on them, and he sat upon them.

title: Matthew 21:8
content: 8 Now the largest crowd spread their cloaks on the road, and others were cutting branches from the trees and were spreading {them} on the road.

title: Matthew 21:9
content: 9 Now the crowds going before him and following were crying out, saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is the one coming in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”

title: Matthew 21:10
content: 10 And {when} he had entered into Jerusalem, the whole city was shaken, saying, “Who is this?”

title: Matthew 21:11
content: 11 And the crowds were saying, “This is Jesus the prophet from Nazareth of Galilee.”

title: Matthew 21:12
content: 12 And Jesus entered into the temple and cast out all the ones selling and buying in the temple, and he overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of the ones selling the doves.

title: Matthew 21:13
content: 13 And he says to them, “It has been written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’ but you make it a ‘den of robbers.’”

title: Matthew 21:14
content: 14 And the blind and the lame approached him in the temple, and he healed them.

title: Matthew 21:15
content: 15 But the chief priests and the scribes, having seen the marvelous things that he did, and the children crying out in the temple and saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David,” became very angry.

title: Matthew 21:16
content: 16 And they said to him, “Do you hear what these are saying?” But Jesus says to them, “Yes! Have you never read,

title: Matthew 21:17
content: 17 And having left them, he went out from the city to Bethany and spent the night there.

title: Matthew 21:18
content: 18 Now in the morning, returning to the city, he was hungry.

title: Matthew 21:19
content: 19 And having seen one fig tree along the road, he went to it and found nothing on it except leaves only. And he says to it, “May there no longer be fruit from you to eternity,” and immediately the fig tree withered.

title: Matthew 21:20
content: 20 And having seen this, the disciples marveled, saying, “How did the fig tree immediately wither?”

title: Matthew 21:21
content: 21 But answering, Jesus said to them, “Truly I say to you, if you have faith and do not doubt, you will not only do {what was} of the fig tree, but also if you say to this mountain, ‘Be taken up and be thrown into the sea,’ it will happen.

title: Matthew 21:22
content: 22 And everything, as much as you request in prayer, believing, you will receive.”

title: Matthew 21:23
content: 23 And {when} he had come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people approached him teaching, saying, “By what authority do you do these things, and who gave you this authority?”

title: Matthew 21:24
content: 24 But answering, Jesus said to them, “I also will ask you one word, which if you tell me, I also will tell you by what authority I do these things.

title: Matthew 21:25
content: 25 The baptism of John—from where was it? From heaven or from men?” But they were reasoning among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say to us, ‘For what {reason} then did you not believe him?’

title: Matthew 21:26
content: 26 But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the crowd, for they all regard John as a prophet.”

title: Matthew 21:27
content: 27 And answering Jesus, they said, “We do not know.” He also said to them, “Nor do I tell you by what authority I do these things.

title: Matthew 21:28
content: 28 But what do you think? A man had two children, and having approached the first, he said, ‘Child, go, work today in the vineyard.’

title: Matthew 21:29
content: 29 But he, answering, said, ‘I will not,’ but afterward, having changed his mind, he went.

title: Matthew 21:30
content: 30 But having approached the other, he said likewise. And he, answering, said, ‘I will, lord,’ but he did not go.

title: Matthew 21:31
content: 31 Which of the two did the will of his father?” They say, “The first.” Jesus says to them, “Truly I say to you that the tax collectors and the prostitutes enter into the kingdom of God before you.

title: Matthew 21:32
content: 32 For John came to you in the way of righteousness, but you did not believe him. But the tax collectors and the prostitutes believed him. But you, having seen this, did not change your minds afterward to believe in him.

title: Matthew 21:33
content: 33 Listen to another parable. There was a man, a master of a house, who planted a vineyard and put a hedge around it and dug a winepress in it and built a watchtower and rented it out to farmers and went abroad.

title: Matthew 21:34
content: 34 Now when the time of the fruits came near, he sent his servants to the farmers to receive his fruits.

title: Matthew 21:35
content: 35 But the farmers, having seized his servants, beat one, and killed another, and stoned another.

title: Matthew 21:36
content: 36 Again, he sent other servants, more than the first, but they did to them likewise.

title: Matthew 21:37
content: 37 But afterward, he sent to them his son, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

title: Matthew 21:38
content: 38 But the farmers, having seen the son, said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him and have his inheritance.’

title: Matthew 21:39
content: 39 And having seized him, they threw him out of the vineyard and killed {him}.

title: Matthew 21:40
content: 40 Therefore, when the lord of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those farmers?”

title: Matthew 21:41
content: 41 They say to him, “He will severely destroy those evil ones, and he will rent out the vineyard to other farmers who will repay him the fruits in their times.”

title: Matthew 21:42
content: 42 Jesus says to them, “Did you never read in the Scriptures, ‘A stone that the builders rejected, this has become the head of the corner. This came about from the Lord, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?

title: Matthew 21:43
content: 43 For this reason I say to you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and will be given to a nation producing its fruits.

title: Matthew 21:44
content: 44 And the one having fallen on this stone will be broken to pieces, but on whomever it falls, it will crush him.”

title: Matthew 21:45
content: 45 And the chief priests and the Pharisees, having heard his parables, knew that he is speaking about them.

title: Matthew 21:46
content: 46 And seeking to seize him, they feared the crowds, because they were regarding him as a prophet.

title: Matthew 22:1
content: 1 And answering, Jesus again spoke to them in parables, saying,

title: Matthew 22:2
content: 2 “The kingdom of the heavens is compared to a man, a king, who made a wedding feast for his son.

title: Matthew 22:3
content: 3 And he sent out his servants to call the ones having been invited to the wedding feast, and they were not willing to come.

title: Matthew 22:4
content: 4 Again he sent other servants, saying, ‘Say to the ones having been invited, “Behold, I have prepared my dinner. My bulls and fattened calves have been killed, and all things are ready. Come to the wedding feast.”’

title: Matthew 22:5
content: 5 But they, having paid no attention, went away, one to his own field and one to his business.

title: Matthew 22:6
content: 6 But the rest, having seized his servants, mistreated and killed {them}.

title: Matthew 22:7
content: 7 But the king became angry, and having sent his soldiers, he destroyed those murderers and burned their city.

title: Matthew 22:8
content: 8 Then he says to his servants, ‘The wedding feast is ready, but the ones having been invited were not worthy.

title: Matthew 22:9
content: 9 Therefore, go to the crossings of the roads and invite as many as you find to the wedding feast.’

title: Matthew 22:10
content: 10 And those servants, having gone out to the roads, gathered together all whom they found, both evil and good, and the wedding was filled {with those} reclining to eat.

title: Matthew 22:11
content: 11 But the king, having come in to look at the ones reclining to eat, saw there a man not wearing wedding clothes.

title: Matthew 22:12
content: 12 And he says to him, ‘Friend, how did you come in here, not having wedding clothes?’ But he was silent.

title: Matthew 22:13
content: 13 Then the king said to the servants, ‘Having bound his feet and hands, throw him out into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and grinding of the teeth.’

title: Matthew 22:14
content: 14 For many are called, but few chosen.”

title: Matthew 22:15
content: 15 Then having gone, the Pharisees took counsel how they might entrap him in word.

title: Matthew 22:16
content: 16 And they send to him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that you are truthful, and you teach the way of God in truth, and it is not a concern to you about anyone, for you do not look at the face of men.

title: Matthew 22:17
content: 17 Therefore, tell us, what do you think? Is it lawful to give a poll tax to Caesar, or not?”

title: Matthew 22:18
content: 18 But Jesus, having known their wickedness, said, “Why are you testing me, hypocrites?

title: Matthew 22:19
content: 19 Show me the coin of the poll tax.” And they brought a denarius to him.

title: Matthew 22:20
content: 20 And he says to them, “Whose image and inscription {is} this?”

title: Matthew 22:21
content: 21 They say, “Caesar’s.” Then he says to them, “Therefore, give back the things of Caesar to Caesar, and the things of God to God.”

title: Matthew 22:22
content: 22 And having heard {it}, they marveled, and having left him, they went away.

title: Matthew 22:23
content: 23 On that day Sadducees, saying there is no resurrection, approached him and questioned him,

title: Matthew 22:24
content: 24 saying, “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If someone dies, not having children, his brother will marry his wife and will raise up seed for his brother.’

title: Matthew 22:25
content: 25 But there were among us seven brothers, and the first, having married, died. And not having seed, he left his wife to his brother.

title: Matthew 22:26
content: 26 Likewise also, the second and the third, until the seven.

title: Matthew 22:27
content: 27 And last of all, the woman died.

title: Matthew 22:28
content: 28 Therefore, in the resurrection, of which of the seven will she be a wife? For they all had her.”

title: Matthew 22:29
content: 29 But answering, Jesus said to them, “You are being led astray, not knowing the Scriptures or the power of God.

title: Matthew 22:30
content: 30 For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but they are like angels in heaven.

title: Matthew 22:31
content: 31 But concerning the resurrection of the dead, have you not read {what} was spoken to you by God, saying,

title: Matthew 22:32
content: 32 ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not a God of the dead, but of the living.”

title: Matthew 22:33
content: 33 And having heard this, the crowds were astonished at his teaching.

title: Matthew 22:34
content: 34 But the Pharisees, having heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, gathered together at the same place.

title: Matthew 22:35
content: 35 And one of them, a lawyer, questioned {him}, testing him—

title: Matthew 22:36
content: 36 “Teacher, which {is} the great commandment in the law?”

title: Matthew 22:37
content: 37 But he said to him, “‘You will love the Lord your God with your whole heart, and with your whole soul, and with your whole mind.’

title: Matthew 22:38
content: 38 This is the great and first commandment.

title: Matthew 22:39
content: 39 Now a second {is} like it—‘You will love your neighbor as yourself.’

title: Matthew 22:40
content: 40 On these two commandments are hung the whole Law and the Prophets.”

title: Matthew 22:41
content: 41 Now the Pharisees having been gathered together, Jesus questioned them,

title: Matthew 22:42
content: 42 saying, “What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?” They say to him, “David’s.”

title: Matthew 22:43
content: 43 He says to them, “How then does David in the Spirit call him ‘Lord,’ saying,

title: Matthew 22:44
content: 44 ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, until I put your enemies under your feet”’?

title: Matthew 22:45
content: 45 If David therefore calls him ‘Lord,’ how is he his son?”

title: Matthew 22:46
content: 46 And no one was able to answer him a word, nor did anyone dare from that day to question him any longer.

title: Matthew 23:1
content: 1 Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and to his disciples,

title: Matthew 23:2
content: 2 saying, “The scribes and the Pharisees sat in the seat of Moses.

title: Matthew 23:3
content: 3 Therefore, everything, as much as they say to you, do and keep. But do not do according to their works, for they say and do not do.

title: Matthew 23:4
content: 4 And they tie up loads, heavy and difficult to carry, and they put {them} on the shoulders of men, but they themselves are not willing with their finger to move them.

title: Matthew 23:5
content: 5 But they do all their deeds to be seen by men. For they broaden their phylacteries and they lengthen their tassels.

title: Matthew 23:6
content: 6 And they love the first places at the banquets and the first seats in the synagogues,

title: Matthew 23:7
content: 7 and the greetings in the marketplaces, and to be called ‘Rabbi’ by men.

title: Matthew 23:8
content: 8 But you should not be called ‘Rabbi,’ for one is your teacher, and you are all brothers.

title: Matthew 23:9
content: 9 And you should not call {anyone} on the earth your father, for one is your heavenly Father.

title: Matthew 23:10
content: 10 And you should not be called ‘teacher,’ for your teacher is one, the Christ.

title: Matthew 23:11
content: 11 But the greatest among you will be your servant.

title: Matthew 23:12
content: 12 But whoever will exalt himself will be humbled, and whoever will humble himself will be exalted.

title: Matthew 23:13
content: 13 But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you shut the kingdom of the heavens in front of men. For you do not enter in, nor do you permit the ones entering to enter.

title: Matthew 23:14
content: 14 [But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you devour the houses of widows, also for a pretext praying at length. For this reason, you will receive greater judgment.]

title: Matthew 23:15
content: 15 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you go around the sea and the dry land to make one proselyte, and when he becomes {one}, you make him twice as much a son of Gehenna as you.

title: Matthew 23:16
content: 16 Woe to you, blind guides, the ones saying, ‘Whoever swears by the temple, it is nothing. But whoever swears by the gold of the temple, he is obligated.’

title: Matthew 23:17
content: 17 Foolish and blind! For which is greater, the gold or the temple having sanctified the gold?

title: Matthew 23:18
content: 18 And, ‘Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing. But whoever swears by the gift on top of it, he is obligated.’

title: Matthew 23:19
content: 19 Foolish and blind! For which {is} greater, the gift or the altar sanctifying the gift?

title: Matthew 23:20
content: 20 Therefore, the one having sworn by the altar swears by it and by everything {that is} on top of it.

title: Matthew 23:21
content: 21 And the one having sworn by the temple swears by it and by the one inhabiting it.

title: Matthew 23:22
content: 22 And the one having sworn by heaven swears by the throne of God and by the one sitting on it.

title: Matthew 23:23
content: 23 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you tithe the mint and the dill and the cumin, but you have neglected the weightier {things} of the law—justice and mercy and faith. But it was necessary to do these and those not to neglect.

title: Matthew 23:24
content: 24 Blind guides, the ones straining out the gnat but swallowing the camel!

title: Matthew 23:25
content: 25 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you clean the outside of the cup and of the plate, but inside they are full of greed and lack of self-control.

title: Matthew 23:26
content: 26 Blind Pharisee! Clean first the inside of the cup and of the plate, so that the outside of them might become clean also.

title: Matthew 23:27
content: 27 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitewashed tombs, which on the outside appear beautiful, but on the inside are full of bones of the dead and all uncleanness.

title: Matthew 23:28
content: 28 In the same way, you also on the outside appear righteous to men, but on the inside you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.

title: Matthew 23:29
content: 29 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you build the tombs of the prophets and decorate the tombs of the righteous.

title: Matthew 23:30
content: 30 And you say, ‘If we were in the days of our fathers, we would not have been sharers with them in the blood of the prophets.’

title: Matthew 23:31
content: 31 Therefore you testify against yourselves that you are sons of the ones having killed the prophets.

title: Matthew 23:32
content: 32 And you, fill up the measure of your fathers!

title: Matthew 23:33
content: 33 Serpents, offspring of vipers, how might you escape from the judgment of Gehenna?

title: Matthew 23:34
content: 34 For this reason, behold, I am sending to you prophets and wise {ones} and scribes. From them you will kill and crucify, and from them you will whip in your synagogues and pursue from city to city,

title: Matthew 23:35
content: 35 so that might come upon you all the righteous blood being shed on the earth, from the blood of Abel the righteous to the blood of Zechariah son of Barachiah, whom you killed between the temple and the altar.

title: Matthew 23:36
content: 36 Truly I say to you, all these things will come upon this generation.

title: Matthew 23:37
content: 37 Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the one killing the prophets and stoning the ones having been sent to her! How often I desired to gather your children the way a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you were not willing!

title: Matthew 23:38
content: 38 Behold, your house is left to you desolate.

title: Matthew 23:39
content: 39 For I say to you, you will certainly not see me from now until you say, ‘Blessed is the one coming in the name of the Lord!’”

title: Matthew 24:1
content: 1 And Jesus, having gone out from the temple, was going away. And his disciples approached {him} to show him the buildings of the temple.

title: Matthew 24:2
content: 2 But he, answering, said to them, “Do you not see all these things? Truly I say to you, a stone upon a stone will certainly not be left here, which will not be torn down.”

title: Matthew 24:3
content: 3 Now {as} he was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples approached him by themselves, saying, “Tell us, when will these things be? And what {is} the sign of your coming and of the end of the age?”

title: Matthew 24:4
content: 4 And answering, Jesus said to them, “Be careful that no one leads you astray.

title: Matthew 24:5
content: 5 For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and they will lead many astray.

title: Matthew 24:6
content: 6 And you are going to hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you are not troubled, for it is necessary {for this} to happen, but the end is not yet.

title: Matthew 24:7
content: 7 For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom, and there will be famines and earthquakes in various places.

title: Matthew 24:8
content: 8 But all these things {are} the beginning of birth pains.

title: Matthew 24:9
content: 9 Then they will hand you over to tribulation and will kill you, and you will be hated by all the nations because of my name.

title: Matthew 24:10
content: 10 And then many will be caused to stumble and will hand one another over and will hate one another.

title: Matthew 24:11
content: 11 And many false prophets will be raised up and will lead many astray.

title: Matthew 24:12
content: 12 And because lawlessness will be increased, the love of many will grow cold.

title: Matthew 24:13
content: 13 But the one having endured to the end, this one will be saved.

title: Matthew 24:14
content: 14 And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in the whole world for a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come.

title: Matthew 24:15
content: 15 Therefore, when you see the abomination of desolation having been spoken of by Daniel the prophet standing in the holy place” (let the one reading understand),

title: Matthew 24:16
content: 16 “then let the ones in Judea flee to the mountains,

title: Matthew 24:17
content: 17 let the one on the housetop not go down to take anything from his house,

title: Matthew 24:18
content: 18 and let the one in the field not turn back to take his cloak.

title: Matthew 24:19
content: 19 But woe to the ones having in the womb and to the ones nursing in those days!

title: Matthew 24:20
content: 20 But pray that your flight might not happen in winter nor on a Sabbath.

title: Matthew 24:21
content: 21 For then will be great tribulation, such as has not happened from the beginning of the world until now, nor will ever happen.

title: Matthew 24:22
content: 22 And if those days had not been shortened, no flesh would be saved. But because of the elect, those days will be shortened.

title: Matthew 24:23
content: 23 Then if anyone says to you, ‘Behold, here {is} the Christ!’ or, ‘Here!’ you should not believe {it}.

title: Matthew 24:24
content: 24 For false Christs and false prophets will be raised up and will give great signs and wonders, so as to lead astray, if possible, even the elect.

title: Matthew 24:25
content: 25 Behold, I have told you beforehand.

title: Matthew 24:26
content: 26 Therefore, if they say to you, ‘Behold, he is in the wilderness,’ you should not go out; ‘Behold, in the inner chambers,’ you should not believe {it}.

title: Matthew 24:27
content: 27 For just as the lightning comes out from the east and shines as far as the west, thus will be the coming of the Son of Man.

title: Matthew 24:28
content: 28 Wherever the corpse is, there the vultures will be gathered.

title: Matthew 24:29
content: 29 But immediately after the tribulation of those days the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light, and the stars will fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

title: Matthew 24:30
content: 30 And then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn. And they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and much glory.

title: Matthew 24:31
content: 31 And he will send his angels with a great trumpet, and they will gather together his elect from the four winds, from the ends of the heavens to the ends of them.

title: Matthew 24:32
content: 32 Now learn the parable from the fig tree: When its branch already becomes tender and it puts out leaves, you know that the summer {is} near.

title: Matthew 24:33
content: 33 Thus also you, when you see all these things, know that it is near, at the doors.

title: Matthew 24:34
content: 34 Truly I say to you that this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things happen.

title: Matthew 24:35
content: 35 The heaven and the earth will pass away, but my words will certainly not pass away.

title: Matthew 24:36
content: 36 But concerning that day and hour no one knows, neither the angels of the heavens, nor the Son, except the Father only.

title: Matthew 24:37
content: 37 For just as the days of Noah, thus will be the coming of the Son of Man.

title: Matthew 24:38
content: 38 For as in the days before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until that day Noah entered into the ark,

title: Matthew 24:39
content: 39 and they did not know until the flood came and took {them} all away, thus also will be the coming of the Son of Man.

title: Matthew 24:40
content: 40 Then two will be in the field—one is taken, and one is left.

title: Matthew 24:41
content: 41 Two grinding with the mill—one is taken, and one is left.

title: Matthew 24:42
content: 42 Therefore, be alert, for you do not know on what day your Lord will come.

title: Matthew 24:43
content: 43 But know this, that if the master of the house had known in which watch the thief comes, he would have been alert and would not have allowed his house to be broken into.

title: Matthew 24:44
content: 44 For this reason you also be ready, because in that hour you do not think, the Son of Man comes.

title: Matthew 24:45
content: 45 Who then is the faithful and wise slave whom the master has appointed over his household to give them their food in time?

title: Matthew 24:46
content: 46 Blessed {is} that slave whom his master, having come, will find doing thus.

title: Matthew 24:47
content: 47 Truly I say to you that he will appoint him over all his possessions.

title: Matthew 24:48
content: 48 But if that evil slave says in his heart, ‘My master delays,’

title: Matthew 24:49
content: 49 and he begins to beat his fellow slaves and eats and drinks with the ones being drunk,

title: Matthew 24:50
content: 50 the master of that slave will come on a day that he does not expect and at an hour that he does not know,

title: Matthew 24:51
content: 51 and he will cut him in two and appoint his place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and grinding of the teeth.

title: Matthew 25:1
content: 1 Then the kingdom of the heavens will be compared to ten virgins who, having taken their lamps, went out to a meeting of the bridegroom.

title: Matthew 25:2
content: 2 Now five of them were foolish and five wise.

title: Matthew 25:3
content: 3 For the foolish, having taken their lamps, did not take oil with them.

title: Matthew 25:4
content: 4 But the wise took oil in the containers with their lamps.

title: Matthew 25:5
content: 5 But the bridegroom delaying, they all became sleepy and were sleeping.

title: Matthew 25:6
content: 6 But in the middle of the night there was a cry, ‘Behold, the bridegroom! Go out to the meeting.’

title: Matthew 25:7
content: 7 Then all those virgins got up and put their lamps in order.

title: Matthew 25:8
content: 8 Now the foolish said to the wise, ‘Give us from your oil, because our lamps are going out.’

title: Matthew 25:9
content: 9 But the wise answered, saying, ‘There will certainly not ever be enough for us and for you. Go instead to the ones selling and buy for yourselves.’

title: Matthew 25:10
content: 10 But, they going away to buy, the bridegroom came, and the prepared entered with him into the wedding feast, and the door was shut.

title: Matthew 25:11
content: 11 But afterward also the rest of the virgins come, saying, ‘Lord, lord, open for us!’

title: Matthew 25:12
content: 12 But he, answering, said, ‘Truly I say to you, I do not know you.’

title: Matthew 25:13
content: 13 Therefore, be alert, for you do not know the day nor the hour.

title: Matthew 25:14
content: 14 For {it is} as if a man, going abroad, called his own slaves and handed over to them his possessions.

title: Matthew 25:15
content: 15 And to one he gave five talents, and to one, two, and to one, one—to each according to his own ability. And immediately he went abroad.

title: Matthew 25:16
content: 16 Having gone, the one having received the five talents traded with them and gained another five talents.

title: Matthew 25:17
content: 17 Likewise, the one with the two also gained another two.

title: Matthew 25:18
content: 18 But the one having received the one, having gone away, dug in the ground and hid the money of his master.

title: Matthew 25:19
content: 19 Now after a long time, the master of those slaves comes and takes up a word together with them.

title: Matthew 25:20
content: 20 And having approached, the one having received the five talents brought another five talents, saying, ‘Master, you handed over to me five talents; behold, I gained another five talents.’

title: Matthew 25:21
content: 21 His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave! You were faithful over a few things. I will appoint you over many things. Enter into the joy of your master.’

title: Matthew 25:22
content: 22 Having approached, also the one with the two talents said, ‘Master, you handed over to me two talents; behold, I gained another two talents.’

title: Matthew 25:23
content: 23 His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave! You were faithful over a few things. I will appoint you over many things. Enter into the joy of your master.’

title: Matthew 25:24
content: 24 But having approached, also the one having received the one talent said, ‘Master, I knew you, that you are a harsh man, reaping where you did not sow, and gathering where you did not scatter.

title: Matthew 25:25
content: 25 And having become afraid, having gone away, I hid your talent in the ground. Behold, you have {what is} yours.’

title: Matthew 25:26
content: 26 But answering, his master said to him, ‘Wicked and lazy slave! Did you know that I reap where I did not sow and gather where I did not scatter?

title: Matthew 25:27
content: 27 Therefore, it was necessary for you to have put my money with the bankers, and having come, I would have received back {what is} mine with interest.

title: Matthew 25:28
content: 28 Therefore, take away the talent from him and give it to the one having the ten talents.

title: Matthew 25:29
content: 29 For to everyone having, it will be given and it will abound. But from the one not having, even what he has will be taken away from him.

title: Matthew 25:30
content: 30 And throw the worthless slave out into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and grinding of the teeth.’

title: Matthew 25:31
content: 31 Now when the Son of Man comes in his glory and all the angels with him, then he will sit on his throne of glory.

title: Matthew 25:32
content: 32 And before him will be gathered all the nations, and he will separate them from one another, just as the shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

title: Matthew 25:33
content: 33 And he will place the sheep on his right, but the goats on his left.

title: Matthew 25:34
content: 34 Then the King will say to the ones on his right, ‘Come, the ones having been blessed by my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.

title: Matthew 25:35
content: 35 For I was hungry, and you gave me to eat; I was thirsty, and you gave me to drink; I was a stranger, and you gathered together with me;

title: Matthew 25:36
content: 36 {I was} naked, and you clothed me; I was sick, and you cared for me; I was in prison, and you came to me.’

title: Matthew 25:37
content: 37 Then the righteous will answer him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you being hungry and feed {you}? Or being thirsty and give {you} to drink?

title: Matthew 25:38
content: 38 And when did we see you a stranger and gather together with {you}? Or naked and clothe {you}?

title: Matthew 25:39
content: 39 And when did we see you sick or in prison and come to you?’

title: Matthew 25:40
content: 40 And answering, the King will say to them, ‘Truly I say to you, as much as you did for one of the least of these brothers of mine, you did for me.’

title: Matthew 25:41
content: 41 Then he will say also to the ones on his left, ‘Go from me, the ones having been cursed, into the eternal fire that has been prepared for the devil and his angels.

title: Matthew 25:42
content: 42 For I was hungry, and you did not give me to eat; I was thirsty, and you did not give me to drink;

title: Matthew 25:43
content: 43 I was a stranger, and you did not gather together with me; {I was} naked, and you did not clothe me; {I was} sick and in prison, and you did not care for me.’

title: Matthew 25:44
content: 44 Then they also will answer, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not serve you?’

title: Matthew 25:45
content: 45 Then he will answer them, saying, ‘Truly I say to you, as much as you did not do for one of the least of these, you did not do for me.’

title: Matthew 25:46
content: 46 And these will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”

title: Matthew 26:1
content: 1 And it happened that when Jesus had finished all these words, he said to his disciples,

title: Matthew 26:2
content: 2 “You know that after two days the Passover happens, and the Son of Man is handed over to be crucified.”

title: Matthew 26:3
content: 3 Then the chief priests and the elders of the people were gathered together in the courtyard of the chief priest, the one called Caiaphas.

title: Matthew 26:4
content: 4 And they took counsel together in order that they might seize Jesus by deceit and kill him.

title: Matthew 26:5
content: 5 But they were saying, “Not during the festival, so that a riot does not happen among the people.”

title: Matthew 26:6
content: 6 Now, Jesus being in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper,

title: Matthew 26:7
content: 7 a woman approached him having an alabaster jar of very expensive perfumed oil, and she poured {it} upon his head, {he} reclining to eat.

title: Matthew 26:8
content: 8 Now having seen this, the disciples became very angry, saying, “For what {is} this waste?

title: Matthew 26:9
content: 9 For this was able to be sold for much and given to the poor.”

title: Matthew 26:10
content: 10 But Jesus, knowing this, said to them, “Why are you causing trouble for the woman? For she did a good work for me.

title: Matthew 26:11
content: 11 For you always have the poor with you, but you do not always have me.

title: Matthew 26:12
content: 12 For she, putting this perfumed oil on my body, did {it} to prepare me for burial.

title: Matthew 26:13
content: 13 Truly I say to you, wherever this gospel is preached in the whole world, also what she did will be spoken in remembrance of her.”

title: Matthew 26:14
content: 14 Then one of the Twelve, the one called Judas Iscariot, having gone to the chief priests,

title: Matthew 26:15
content: 15 said, “What are you willing to give me, and I will hand him over to you?” And they weighed out 30 pieces of silver for him.

title: Matthew 26:16
content: 16 And from then he was seeking an opportunity in order that he might hand him over.

title: Matthew 26:17
content: 17 Now on the first of the Festival of Unleavened Bread the disciples approached Jesus, saying, “Where do you want {that} we might prepare for you to eat the Passover?”

title: Matthew 26:18
content: 18 And he said, “Go into the city to so-and-so and say to him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is near. I with my disciples am doing the Passover with you.”’”

title: Matthew 26:19
content: 19 And the disciples did as Jesus directed them, and they prepared the Passover.

title: Matthew 26:20
content: 20 Now evening having come, he was reclining to eat with the Twelve.

title: Matthew 26:21
content: 21 And they eating, he said, “Truly I say to you that one of you will hand me over.”

title: Matthew 26:22
content: 22 And being very grieved, each one began to say to him, “Surely not I, Lord?”

title: Matthew 26:23
content: 23 But he, answering, said, “The one having dipped his hand with me in the bowl, this one will hand me over.

title: Matthew 26:24
content: 24 The Son of Man departs just as it has been written about him. But woe to that man through whom the Son of Man is handed over! It would have been good for him if that man had not been born.”

title: Matthew 26:25
content: 25 But answering, Judas, the one handing him over, said, “Surely not I, Rabbi?” He says to him, “You said {it}.”

title: Matthew 26:26
content: 26 Now they eating, Jesus, having taken bread and having blessed, broke {it}. And having given {it} to the disciples, he said, “Take, eat. This is my body.”

title: Matthew 26:27
content: 27 And having taken a cup and having given thanks, he gave {it} to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you.

title: Matthew 26:28
content: 28 For this is my blood of the covenant that is being poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.

title: Matthew 26:29
content: 29 But I say to you, I will certainly not drink from now from this fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new with you in the kingdom of my Father.”

title: Matthew 26:30
content: 30 And having sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

title: Matthew 26:31
content: 31 Then Jesus says to them, “You all will be caused to stumble on me in this night, for it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’

title: Matthew 26:32
content: 32 But after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.”

title: Matthew 26:33
content: 33 But answering, Peter said to him, “If all will be caused to stumble on you, I never will be caused to stumble.”

title: Matthew 26:34
content: 34 Jesus said to him, “Truly I say to you that in this night, before a rooster crows, you will deny me three times.”

title: Matthew 26:35
content: 35 Peter says to him, “Even if it were necessary for me to die with you, I will certainly not deny you.” All the disciples also said likewise.

title: Matthew 26:36
content: 36 Then Jesus comes with them to a place called Gethsemane and says to the disciples, “Sit here while, having gone away there, I pray.”

title: Matthew 26:37
content: 37 And having taken along Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, he began to be grieved and greatly troubled.

title: Matthew 26:38
content: 38 Then he says to them, “My soul is very grieved, to death. Remain here and be alert with me.”

title: Matthew 26:39
content: 39 And having gone a little farther, he fell on his face, praying and saying, “My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass away from me. Yet, not as I will, but as you.”

title: Matthew 26:40
content: 40 And he comes to the disciples and finds them sleeping, and he says to Peter, “So, were you not able to be alert with me for one hour?

title: Matthew 26:41
content: 41 Be alert and pray so that you do not enter into temptation. The spirit indeed {is} willing, but the flesh {is} weak.”

title: Matthew 26:42
content: 42 Again, having gone away a second time, he prayed, saying, “My Father, if this is not able to pass away unless I drink it, let your will be done.”

title: Matthew 26:43
content: 43 And having come again, he found them sleeping, for their eyes were weighed down.

title: Matthew 26:44
content: 44 And having left them again, having gone away, he prayed a third time, having said the same word again.

title: Matthew 26:45
content: 45 Then he comes to the disciples and says to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Behold, the hour has come near, and the Son of Man is handed over into the hands of sinners.

title: Matthew 26:46
content: 46 Get up, let us go. Behold, the one handing me over has come near.”

title: Matthew 26:47
content: 47 And he still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the Twelve, came, and with him a large crowd with swords and clubs from the chief priests and elders of the people.

title: Matthew 26:48
content: 48 Now the one handing him over gave them a sign, saying, “Whomever I kiss is he. Seize him.”

title: Matthew 26:49
content: 49 And immediately, having approached Jesus, he said, “Rejoice, Rabbi!” and he kissed him.

title: Matthew 26:50
content: 50 But Jesus said to him, “Friend, for what are you present?” Then having approached, they laid hands on Jesus and seized him.

title: Matthew 26:51
content: 51 And behold, one of the ones with Jesus, having stretched out his hand, drew his sword, and having struck the servant of the high priest, cut off his ear.

title: Matthew 26:52
content: 52 Then Jesus says to him, “Return your sword to its place, for all the ones having taken a sword will perish by a sword.

title: Matthew 26:53
content: 53 Or do you think that I am not able to beg my Father, and he will provide me now with more than 12 legions of angels?

title: Matthew 26:54
content: 54 How then would the scriptures be fulfilled, that it is necessary to happen in this way?”

title: Matthew 26:55
content: 55 At that hour Jesus said to the crowds, “As against a robber have you come out with swords and clubs to seize me? Every day I was sitting in the temple teaching, and you did not seize me.

title: Matthew 26:56
content: 56 But all this has happened so that the writings of the prophets might be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples, having left him, fled.

title: Matthew 26:57
content: 57 Now the ones having seized Jesus led {him} away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were gathered together.

title: Matthew 26:58
content: 58 But Peter was following him from a distance, as far as the courtyard of the high priest. And having entered inside, he was sitting down with the officers to see the end.

title: Matthew 26:59
content: 59 Now the chief priests and the entire Sanhedrin were seeking false testimony against Jesus so that they might put him to death.

title: Matthew 26:60
content: 60 And they did not find {any}, many false witnesses having approached. But later two, having approached,

title: Matthew 26:61
content: 61 said, “This one said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and to rebuild {it} in three days.’”

title: Matthew 26:62
content: 62 And having stood up, the high priest said to him, “Do you answer nothing? What are these testifying against you?”

title: Matthew 26:63
content: 63 But Jesus was silent. And the high priest said to him, “I make you swear by the living God that you tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God.”

title: Matthew 26:64
content: 64 Jesus says to him, “You said {it}. But I say to you, from now you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of power and coming on the clouds of heaven.”

title: Matthew 26:65
content: 65 Then the high priest tore his robes, saying, “He has blasphemed! Why do we still have need of witnesses? Behold, now you have heard the blasphemy.

title: Matthew 26:66
content: 66 What do you think?” And they, answering, said, “He is deserving of death.”

title: Matthew 26:67
content: 67 Then they spit in his face and beat him. And they slapped him,

title: Matthew 26:68
content: 68 saying, “Prophesy to us, Christ. Who is the one having hit you?”

title: Matthew 26:69
content: 69 Now Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard, and one servant girl approached him, saying, “You also were with Jesus of Galilee.”

title: Matthew 26:70
content: 70 But he denied {it} before all, saying, “I do not know what you are saying.”

title: Matthew 26:71
content: 71 But {he} having gone out to the gateway, another saw him and says to the ones there, “This one was with Jesus the Nazarene.”

title: Matthew 26:72
content: 72 And again he denied {it} with an oath, “I do not know the man!”

title: Matthew 26:73
content: 73 But after a little {while} the ones standing {there}, having approached, said to Peter, “Truly you also are from them, for also your speech makes you evident.”

title: Matthew 26:74
content: 74 Then he began to curse and to swear, “I do not know the man!” And immediately a rooster crowed.

title: Matthew 26:75
content: 75 And Peter remembered the word of Jesus that he had said: “Before a rooster crows you will deny me three times.” And having gone outside, he wept bitterly.

title: Matthew 27:1
content: 1 Now morning having come, all the chief priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus so as to put him to death.

title: Matthew 27:2
content: 2 And having bound him, they led {him} away and handed {him} over to Pilate the governor.

title: Matthew 27:3
content: 3 Then Judas, the one handing him over, having seen that he was condemned, having repented, returned the 30 pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,

title: Matthew 27:4
content: 4 saying, “I have sinned, having handed over innocent blood.” But they said, “What {is that} to us? You will see.”

title: Matthew 27:5
content: 5 And having thrown the pieces of silver into the temple, he withdrew. And having gone out, he hanged himself.

title: Matthew 27:6
content: 6 Now the chief priests, having taken the pieces of silver, said, “It is not lawful to put them into the treasury, because it is the price of blood.”

title: Matthew 27:7
content: 7 But having taken counsel, they bought with them the field of the potter for burial for strangers.

title: Matthew 27:8
content: 8 Therefore, that field has been called Field of Blood to this day.

title: Matthew 27:9
content: 9 Then was fulfilled {what} was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, saying, “And they took the 30 pieces of silver, the price of the one having been priced, whom they from the sons of Israel priced,

title: Matthew 27:10
content: 10 and they gave them for the field of the potter, just as the Lord directed me.”

title: Matthew 27:11
content: 11 Now Jesus was stood before the governor, and the governor questioned him, saying, “Are you the King of the Jews?” But Jesus said to him, “You say {it}.”

title: Matthew 27:12
content: 12 And when he was accused by the chief priests and the elders, he answered nothing.

title: Matthew 27:13
content: 13 Then Pilate says to him, “Do you not hear how many things they are testifying against you?”

title: Matthew 27:14
content: 14 And he did not answer him, not even to one word, so as to amaze the governor very much.

title: Matthew 27:15
content: 15 Now at the festival the governor had been accustomed to release to the crowd one prisoner whom they were wishing.

title: Matthew 27:16
content: 16 Now at that time they were holding a well-known prisoner named Barabbas.

title: Matthew 27:17
content: 17 Therefore, they being gathered together, Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want {that} I would release to you? Barabbas, or Jesus, the one called Christ?”

title: Matthew 27:18
content: 18 For he knew that they handed him over because of envy.

title: Matthew 27:19
content: 19 Now, he sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent to him, saying, “Nothing to you and to that righteous one, for I suffered many {things} today because of him by means of a dream.”

title: Matthew 27:20
content: 20 But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowds so that they would ask for Barabbas but would destroy Jesus.

title: Matthew 27:21
content: 21 But answering, the governor said to them, “Whom from the two do you want {that} I would release to you?” But they said, “Barabbas.”

title: Matthew 27:22
content: 22 Pilate says to them, “What then should I do with Jesus, the one called Christ?” They all say, “Let him be crucified.”

title: Matthew 27:23
content: 23 But he said, “For what evil did he do?” But they were crying out even more, saying, “Let him be crucified.”

title: Matthew 27:24
content: 24 But Pilate, having seen that he is benefiting nothing, but instead a riot is happening, having taken water, washed his hands opposite the crowd, saying, “I am innocent from the blood of this one. You will see.”

title: Matthew 27:25
content: 25 And answering, all the people said, “His blood {be} on us and on our children!”

title: Matthew 27:26
content: 26 Then he released Barabbas to them, but having flogged Jesus, he handed {him} over so that he might be crucified.

title: Matthew 27:27
content: 27 Then the soldiers of the governor, having taken Jesus into the Praetorium, gathered together to him the whole cohort.

title: Matthew 27:28
content: 28 And having stripped him, they placed a scarlet cloak on him.

title: Matthew 27:29
content: 29 And having woven together a crown of thorns, they put {it} on his head and a reed in his right hand, and having knelt down before him, they mocked him, saying, “Rejoice, King of the Jews!”

title: Matthew 27:30
content: 30 And having spat on him, they took the reed and were striking {him} on his head.

title: Matthew 27:31
content: 31 And when they had mocked him, they took the cloak off him and put his robes on him and led him away to crucify {him}.

title: Matthew 27:32
content: 32 Now coming out, they found a Cyrenean man, Simon by name. They pressed this one into service so that he would carry his cross.

title: Matthew 27:33
content: 33 And having come to a place called Golgotha, which is called Place of a Skull,

title: Matthew 27:34
content: 34 they gave him wine mixed with gall to drink. And having tasted {it}, he was not willing to drink {it}.

title: Matthew 27:35
content: 35 Now having crucified him, they divided up his robes, casting a lot,

title: Matthew 27:36
content: 36 and sitting down, they were guarding him there.

title: Matthew 27:37
content: 37 And they put above his head his charge, having been written, “This is Jesus, the King of the Jews.”

title: Matthew 27:38
content: 38 Then two robbers are being crucified with him, one at his right and one at his left.

title: Matthew 27:39
content: 39 But the ones passing by were blaspheming him, wagging their heads

title: Matthew 27:40
content: 40 and saying, “The one destroying the temple and in three days rebuilding {it}, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, also come down from the cross!”

title: Matthew 27:41
content: 41 Likewise also the chief priests, mocking {him} with the scribes and elders, were saying,

title: Matthew 27:42
content: 42 “He saved others; he is not able to save himself. He is the King of Israel! Let him come down now from the cross, and we will believe in him.

title: Matthew 27:43
content: 43 He has trusted in God; let him deliver {him} now, if he wants him. For he said, ‘I am the Son of God.’”

title: Matthew 27:44
content: 44 But also the robbers having being crucified with him were reviling him the same.

title: Matthew 27:45
content: 45 Now from the sixth hour darkness happened over all the land until the ninth hour.

title: Matthew 27:46
content: 46 But about the ninth hour, Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?” This is, “My God, my God, why did you forsake me?”

title: Matthew 27:47
content: 47 But some of the ones having stood there, having heard {it}, were saying, “This one calls Elijah.”

title: Matthew 27:48
content: 48 And immediately one of them, having run and having taken a sponge, having both filled {it} with vinegar and put {it} around a reed, gave {it} to him to drink.

title: Matthew 27:49
content: 49 But the rest were saying, “Leave {him}! Let us see if Elijah comes, saving him.”

title: Matthew 27:50
content: 50 But Jesus, having cried out again with a loud voice, released his spirit.

title: Matthew 27:51
content: 51 And behold, the curtain of the temple was split in two from top to bottom, and the earth was shaken, and the rocks were split.

title: Matthew 27:52
content: 52 And the tombs were opened, and many bodies of the saints having fallen asleep were raised.

title: Matthew 27:53
content: 53 And having come out from the tombs after his resurrection, they entered into the holy city and appeared to many.

title: Matthew 27:54
content: 54 Now the centurion and the ones with him guarding Jesus, having seen the earthquake and the things having happened, were very afraid, saying, “Truly this was a Son of God.”

title: Matthew 27:55
content: 55 Now there were many women there, watching from a distance, who followed Jesus from Galilee, serving him.

title: Matthew 27:56
content: 56 Among them were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.

title: Matthew 27:57
content: 57 Now evening having come, a rich man from Arimathea came, Joseph by name, who also himself was discipled by Jesus.

title: Matthew 27:58
content: 58 This one, having approached Pilate, asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded {it} to be given {to him}.

title: Matthew 27:59
content: 59 And Joseph, having taken the body, wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

title: Matthew 27:60
content: 60 and put it in his own new tomb, which he had cut in the rock. And having rolled a large stone against the door of the tomb, he went away.

title: Matthew 27:61
content: 61 Now Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were there, sitting opposite the tomb.

title: Matthew 27:62
content: 62 Now the next day, which is after the Day of Preparation, the chief priests and the Pharisees were gathered together to Pilate,

title: Matthew 27:63
content: 63 saying, “Lord, we remember that that deceiver said, still living, ‘After three days I am being raised up.’

title: Matthew 27:64
content: 64 Therefore, command the tomb to be secured until the third day, lest his disciples, having come, might steal him and say to the people, ‘He has been raised up from the dead,’ and the last deception will be worse than the first.”

title: Matthew 27:65
content: 65 And Pilate said to them, “You have a guard. Go, secure {it} as you know.”

title: Matthew 27:66
content: 66 And they, having gone, secured the tomb, having sealed the stone, with the guard.

title: Matthew 28:1
content: 1 Now after the Sabbath, at the dawning on the first of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to watch the tomb.

title: Matthew 28:2
content: 2 And behold, a great earthquake happened, for an angel of the Lord, having come down from heaven and having approached, rolled away the stone and was sitting on it.

title: Matthew 28:3
content: 3 Now his appearance was like lightning, and his clothing white as snow.

title: Matthew 28:4
content: 4 And the ones guarding were shaken from the fear of him and became as dead.

title: Matthew 28:5
content: 5 But answering, the angel said to the women, “You, do not be afraid, for I know that you seek Jesus, the one having been crucified.

title: Matthew 28:6
content: 6 He is not here, for he was raised up, just as he said. Come, see the place where he was lying.

title: Matthew 28:7
content: 7 And having gone quickly, say to his disciples, ‘He has been raised up from the dead. And behold, he is going before you to Galilee. There you will see him.’ Behold, I have said {it} to you.”

title: Matthew 28:8
content: 8 And having quickly gone away from the tomb with fear and great joy, they ran to report {this} to his disciples.

title: Matthew 28:9
content: 9 And behold, Jesus met them, saying, “Rejoice!” But they, having approached, seized his feet and worshiped him.

title: Matthew 28:10
content: 10 Then Jesus says to them, “Do not be afraid. Go, report {this} to my brothers so that they might go away to Galilee, and there they will see me.”

title: Matthew 28:11
content: 11 Now they going, behold, some of the guard, having come into the city, reported to the chief priests all the things having happened.

title: Matthew 28:12
content: 12 And having been gathered together with the elders, and having taken counsel, they gave many pieces of silver to the soldiers,

title: Matthew 28:13
content: 13 saying, “Say, ‘His disciples, having come at night, stole him, we sleeping.’

title: Matthew 28:14
content: 14 And if this is heard by the governor, we will persuade and make you free from concern.”

title: Matthew 28:15
content: 15 And they, having taken the pieces of silver, did as they were taught. And this word has been reported among the Jews until today.

title: Matthew 28:16
content: 16 Now the 11 disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had directed them.

title: Matthew 28:17
content: 17 And having seen him, they worshiped, but they doubted.

title: Matthew 28:18
content: 18 And having approached, Jesus spoke to them, saying, “All authority was given to me in heaven and on the earth.

title: Matthew 28:19
content: 19 Having gone, therefore, disciple all the nations, baptizing them into the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit;

title: Matthew 28:20
content: 20 teaching them to keep everything, as much as I commanded you. And behold, I am with you all the days, until the end of the age.”
